ApplicationGuardContainerProxy.name: Application Guard Container Proxy
ApplicationGuardContainerProxy.summary: Configures the proxy settings for Microsoft Edge Application Guard.

ApplicationGuardFavoritesSyncEnabled.name: Application Guard Favorites Sync Enabled
ApplicationGuardFavoritesSyncEnabled.summary: This policy allows Microsoft Edge computers/devices that have application guard enabled to sync favorites from the host to the container so the favorites match.

ApplicationGuardPassiveModeEnabled.name: Ignore Application Guard site list configuration and browse Edge normally
ApplicationGuardPassiveModeEnabled.summary: Set whether Edge should ignore the Application Guard site list configuration for trusted and untrusted sites.

ApplicationGuardTrafficIdentificationEna.name: Application Guard Traffic Identification
ApplicationGuardTrafficIdentificationEna.summary: If you enable or don't configure this policy, Application Guard will add an extra HTTP header (X-MS-ApplicationGuard-Initiated) to all outbound HTTP requests made from the Application Guard container.

ApplicationGuardUploadBlockingEnabled.name: Prevents files from being uploaded while in Application Guard
ApplicationGuardUploadBlockingEnabled.summary: Sets whether files can be uploaded while in Application Guard.

EdgeDisableDialProtocolForCastDiscovery.name: Disable DIAL protocol for cast device discovery
EdgeDisableDialProtocolForCastDiscovery.summary: Enable this policy to disable the DIAL (Discovery And Launch) protocol for cast device discovery. (If EnableMediaRouter is disabled, this policy will have no effect).

EnableMediaRouter.name: Enable Google Cast
EnableMediaRouter.summary: Enable this policy to enable Google Cast. Users will be able to launch it from the app menu, page context menus, media controls on Cast-enabled websites, and (if shown) the Cast toolbar icon.

ShowCastIconInToolbar.name: Show the cast icon in the toolbar
ShowCastIconInToolbar.summary: Set this policy to true to show the Cast toolbar icon on the toolbar or the overflow menu. Users won't be able to remove it.

CACertificateManagementAllowed.name: Allow users to manage installed CA certificates.
CACertificateManagementAllowed.summary: Setting the policy to All (0) or leaving it unset lets users edit trust settings for all CA certificates, remove user-imported certificates, and import certificates using Certificate Manager. Setting the policy to UserOnly (1) lets users manage only user-imported certificates, but not change trust settings of built-in certificates. Setting it to None (2) lets users view (not manage) CA certificates.

CACertificates.name: TLS server certificates that should be trusted by Microsoft Edge
CACertificates.summary: This policy enables a list of TLS certificates that should be trusted by Microsoft Edge for server authentication.

CACertificatesWithConstraints.name: TLS certificates that should be trusted by Microsoft Edge for server authentication with constraints
CACertificatesWithConstraints.summary: This policy enables a list of TLS certificates that should be trusted by Microsoft Edge for server authentication, with constraints added outside the certificate. If no constraint of a certain type is present, then any name of that type is allowed.

CADistrustedCertificates.name: TLS certificates that should be distrusted by Microsoft Edge for server authentication
CADistrustedCertificates.summary: This policy enables defining a list of certificate public keys that should be distrusted by Microsoft Edge for TLS server

CAHintCertificates.name: TLS certificates that are not trusted or distrusted but can be used in path-building for server authentication
CAHintCertificates.summary: This policy enables defining a list of certificates that are not trusted or distrusted in Microsoft Edge

CAPlatformIntegrationEnabled.name: Use user-added TLS certificates from platform trust stores for server authentication
CAPlatformIntegrationEnabled.summary: If enabled (or unset), user-added TLS certificates from platform trust stores will be used in path-building for TLS server authentication.

AutoSelectCertificateForUrls.name: Automatically select client certificates for these sites
AutoSelectCertificateForUrls.summary: Setting the policy lets you make a list of URL patterns that specify sites for which Microsoft Edge can automatically select a client certificate. The value is an array of stringified JSON dictionaries, each with the form { "pattern": "$URL_PATTERN", "filter" : $FILTER }, where $URL_PATTERN is a content setting pattern. $FILTER restricts the client certificates the browser automatically selects from. Independent of the filter, only certificates that match the server's certificate request are selected.
AutoSelectCertificateForUrls.windows_registry_example_value: SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Edge\AutoSelectCertificateForUrls\1 = "{\"pattern\":\"https://www.contoso.com\",\"filter\":{\"ISSUER\":{\"CN\":\"certificate issuer name\", \"L\": \"certificate issuer location\", \"O\": \"certificate issuer org\", \"OU\": \"certificate issuer org unit\"}, \"SUBJECT\":{\"CN\":\"certificate subject name\", \"L\": \"certificate subject location\", \"O\": \"certificate subject org\", \"OU\": \"certificate subject org unit\"}}}"
AutoSelectCertificateForUrls.macos_preference_example_value:
<array>
<string>{"pattern":"https://www.contoso.com","filter":{"ISSUER":{"CN":"certificate issuer name", "L": "certificate issuer location", "O": "certificate issuer org", "OU": "certificate issuer org unit"}, "SUBJECT":{"CN":"certificate subject name", "L": "certificate subject location", "O": "certificate subject org", "OU": "certificate subject org unit"}}}</string>
</array>

AutomaticDownloadsAllowedForUrls.name: Allow multiple automatic downloads in quick succession on specific sites
AutomaticDownloadsAllowedForUrls.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that are allowed to perform multiple successive automatic downloads.

AutomaticDownloadsBlockedForUrls.name: Block multiple automatic downloads in quick succession on specific sites
AutomaticDownloadsBlockedForUrls.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, where multiple successive automatic downloads aren't allowed.

AutomaticFullscreenAllowedForUrls.name: Allow automatic full screen on specified sites

AutomaticFullscreenBlockedForUrls.name: Block automatic full screen on specified sites

CookiesAllowedForUrls.name: Allow cookies on specific sites
CookiesAllowedForUrls.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that are allowed to set cookies. URL patterns may be a single URL indicating that the site may use cookies on all top-level sites. Patterns may also be two URLs delimited by a comma. The first specifies the site that should be allowed to use cookies. The second specifies the top-level site that the first value should be applied on. If you use a pair of URLs, the first value in the pair supports * but the second value does not. Using * for the first value indicates that all sites may use cookies when the second URL is the top-level site.

CookiesBlockedForUrls.name: Block cookies on specific sites
CookiesBlockedForUrls.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that can't set cookies.

CookiesSessionOnlyForUrls.name: Limit cookies from specific websites to the current session
CookiesSessionOnlyForUrls.summary: Cookies created by websites that match a URL pattern you define are deleted when the session ends (when the window closes).

DataUrlInSvgUseEnabled.name: Data URL support for SVGUseElement
DataUrlInSvgUseEnabled.summary: This policy enables Data URL support for SVGUseElement, which will be disabled

DefaultAutomaticDownloadsSetting.name: Default automatic downloads setting
DefaultAutomaticDownloadsSetting.summary: Set whether websites can perform multiple downloads successively without user interaction. You can enable it for all sites (AllowAutomaticDownloads) or block it for all sites (BlockAutomaticDownloads).

DefaultCookiesSetting.name: Configure cookies
DefaultCookiesSetting.summary: Control whether websites can create cookies on the user's device. This policy is all or nothing - you can let all websites create cookies, or no websites create cookies. You can't use this policy to enable cookies from specific websites.

DefaultFileSystemReadGuardSetting.name: Control use of the File System API for reading
DefaultFileSystemReadGuardSetting.summary: If you set this policy to 3, websites can ask for read access to the host operating system's filesystem using the File System API. If you set this policy to 2, access is denied.

DefaultFileSystemWriteGuardSetting.name: Control use of the File System API for writing
DefaultFileSystemWriteGuardSetting.summary: If you set this policy to 3, websites can ask for write access to the host operating system's filesystem using the File System API. If you set this policy to 2, access is denied.

DefaultGeolocationSetting.name: Default geolocation setting
DefaultGeolocationSetting.summary: Set whether websites can track users' physical locations. You can allow tracking by default ('AllowGeolocation'), deny it by default ('BlockGeolocation'), or ask the user each time a website requests their location ('AskGeolocation').

DefaultImagesSetting.name: Default images setting
DefaultImagesSetting.summary: Set whether websites can display images. You can allow images on all sites ('AllowImages') or block them on all sites ('BlockImages').

DefaultInsecureContentSetting.name: Control use of insecure content exceptions
DefaultInsecureContentSetting.summary: Allows you to set whether users can add exceptions to allow mixed content for specific sites.

DefaultJavaScriptJitSetting.name: Control use of JavaScript JIT
DefaultJavaScriptJitSetting.summary: Allows you to set whether Microsoft Edge will run the v8 JavaScript engine with JIT (Just In Time) compiler enabled or not.

DefaultJavaScriptSetting.name: Default JavaScript setting
DefaultJavaScriptSetting.summary: Set whether websites can run JavaScript. You can allow it for all sites ('AllowJavaScript') or block it for all sites ('BlockJavaScript').

DefaultNotificationsSetting.name: Default notification setting
DefaultNotificationsSetting.summary: Set whether websites can display desktop notifications. You can allow them by default ('AllowNotifications'), deny them by default ('BlockNotifications'), or have the user be asked each time a website wants to show a notification ('AskNotifications').

DefaultPluginsSetting.name: Default Adobe Flash setting (obsolete)
DefaultPluginsSetting.summary: This policy doesn't work because Flash is no longer supported by Microsoft Edge.

DefaultPopupsSetting.name: Default pop-up window setting
DefaultPopupsSetting.summary: Set whether websites can show pop-up windows. You can allow them on all websites ('AllowPopups') or block them on all sites ('BlockPopups').

DefaultThirdPartyStoragePartitioningSett.name: Default setting for third-party storage partitioning
DefaultThirdPartyStoragePartitioningSett.summary: This policy controls whether third-party storage partitioning is allowed by default.

DefaultWebBluetoothGuardSetting.name: Control use of the Web Bluetooth API
DefaultWebBluetoothGuardSetting.summary: Control whether websites can access nearby Bluetooth devices. You can completely block access or require the site to ask the user each time it wants to access a Bluetooth device.

DefaultWebHidGuardSetting.name: Control use of the WebHID API
DefaultWebHidGuardSetting.summary: Setting the policy to 3 lets websites ask for access to HID devices. Setting the policy to 2 denies access to HID devices.

DefaultWebUsbGuardSetting.name: Control use of the WebUSB API
DefaultWebUsbGuardSetting.summary: Set whether websites can access connected USB devices. You can completely block access or ask the user each time a website wants to get access to connected USB devices.

DefaultWindowManagementSetting.name: Default Window Management permission setting
DefaultWindowManagementSetting.summary: Setting the policy to "BlockWindowManagement" (value 2) automatically denies the window management permission to sites by default. This limits the ability of sites to see information about the device's screens and use that information to open and place windows or request fullscreen on specific screens.

FileSystemReadAskForUrls.name: Allow read access via the File System API on these sites
FileSystemReadAskForUrls.summary: Setting the policy lets you list the URL patterns that specify which sites can ask users to grant them read access to files or directories in the host operating system's file system via the File System API.

FileSystemReadBlockedForUrls.name: Block read access via the File System API on these sites
FileSystemReadBlockedForUrls.summary: If you set this policy, you can list the URL patterns that specify which sites can't ask users to grant them read access to files or directories in the host operating system's file system via the File System API.

FileSystemWriteAskForUrls.name: Allow write access to files and directories on these sites
FileSystemWriteAskForUrls.summary: If you set this policy, you can list the URL patterns that specify which sites can ask users to grant them write access to files or directories in the host operating system's file system.

FileSystemWriteBlockedForUrls.name: Block write access to files and directories on these sites
FileSystemWriteBlockedForUrls.summary: If you set this policy, you can list the URL patterns that specify which sites can't ask users to grant them write access to files or directories in the host operating system's file system.

ImagesAllowedForUrls.name: Allow images on these sites
ImagesAllowedForUrls.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that can display images.

ImagesBlockedForUrls.name: Block images on specific sites
ImagesBlockedForUrls.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that aren't allowed to display images.

InsecureContentAllowedForUrls.name: Allow insecure content on specified sites
InsecureContentAllowedForUrls.summary: Create a list of URL patterns to specify sites that can display or, as of version 94, download insecure mixed content (that is, HTTP content on HTTPS sites).

InsecureContentBlockedForUrls.name: Block insecure content on specified sites
InsecureContentBlockedForUrls.summary: Create a list of URL patterns to specify sites that aren't allowed to display blockable (i.e. active) mixed content (that is, HTTP content on HTTPS sites) and for which optionally blockable mixed content upgrades will be disabled.

IntranetFileLinksEnabled.name: Allow intranet zone file URL links from Microsoft Edge to open in Windows File Explorer
IntranetFileLinksEnabled.summary: This setting allows file URL links to intranet zone files from intranet zone HTTPS websites to open Windows File Explorer for that file or directory.

JavaScriptAllowedForUrls.name: Allow JavaScript on specific sites
JavaScriptAllowedForUrls.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that are allowed to run JavaScript.

JavaScriptBlockedForUrls.name: Block JavaScript on specific sites
JavaScriptBlockedForUrls.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that aren't allowed to run JavaScript.

JavaScriptJitAllowedForSites.name: Allow JavaScript to use JIT on these sites
JavaScriptJitAllowedForSites.summary: Allows you to set a list of site url patterns that specify sites which are allowed to run JavaScript with JIT (Just In Time) compiler enabled.

JavaScriptJitBlockedForSites.name: Block JavaScript from using JIT on these sites
JavaScriptJitBlockedForSites.summary: Allows you to set a list of site url patterns that specify sites which are not allowed to run JavaScript JIT (Just In Time) compiler enabled.

LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabled.name: Enable default legacy SameSite cookie behavior setting (obsolete)
LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabled.summary: This policy doesn't work because it was only intended to serve only as a short-term mechanism to give enterprises more time to update their environments if they were found to be incompatible with the SameSite behavior change.

LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabledForDo.name: Revert to legacy SameSite behavior for cookies on specified sites
LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabledForDo.summary: Cookies set for domains match specified patterns will revert to legacy SameSite behavior.

NotificationsAllowedForUrls.name: Allow notifications on specific sites
NotificationsAllowedForUrls.summary: Allows you to create a list of url patterns to specify sites that are allowed to display notifications.

NotificationsBlockedForUrls.name: Block notifications on specific sites
NotificationsBlockedForUrls.summary: Allows you to create a list of url patterns to specify sites that are not allowed to display notifications.

PluginsAllowedForUrls.name: Allow the Adobe Flash plug-in on specific sites (obsolete)
PluginsAllowedForUrls.summary: This policy doesn't work because Flash is no longer supported by Microsoft Edge.

PluginsBlockedForUrls.name: Block the Adobe Flash plug-in on specific sites (obsolete)
PluginsBlockedForUrls.summary: This policy doesn't work because Flash is no longer supported by Microsoft Edge.

PopupsAllowedForUrls.name: Allow pop-up windows on specific sites
PopupsAllowedForUrls.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that can open pop-up windows. Wildcards (*) are allowed.

PopupsBlockedForUrls.name: Block pop-up windows on specific sites
PopupsBlockedForUrls.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that are blocked from opening pop-up windows. Wildcards (*) are allowed.

RegisteredProtocolHandlers.name: Register protocol handlers
RegisteredProtocolHandlers.summary: Set this policy (recommended only) to register a list of protocol handlers. This list is merged with ones registered by the user and both are available to use.

SerialAllowAllPortsForUrls.name: Automatically grant sites permission to connect all serial ports
SerialAllowAllPortsForUrls.summary: Setting the policy allows you to list sites which are automatically granted permission to access all available serial ports.

SerialAllowUsbDevicesForUrls.name: Automatically grant sites permission to connect to USB serial devices
SerialAllowUsbDevicesForUrls.summary: Setting the policy lets you list sites that are automatically granted permission to access USB serial devices with vendor and product IDs that match the vendor_id and product_id fields.

ShowPDFDefaultRecommendationsEnabled.name: Allow notifications to set Microsoft Edge as default PDF reader
ShowPDFDefaultRecommendationsEnabled.summary: This policy setting lets you decide whether employees should receive recommendations to set Microsoft Edge as PDF handler.

SpotlightExperiencesAndRecommendationsEn.name: Choose whether users can receive customized background images and text, suggestions, notifications, and tips for Microsoft services
SpotlightExperiencesAndRecommendationsEn.summary: Choose whether users can receive customized background images and text, suggestions, notifications, and tips for Microsoft services.

ThirdPartyStoragePartitioningBlockedForO.name: Disable third-party storage partitioning for specific top-level origins
ThirdPartyStoragePartitioningBlockedForO.summary: This policy lets you set a list of URL patterns that specify top-level origins for which third-party storage partitioning (partitioning of cross-origin iframe storage) should be disabled.

WebHidAllowAllDevicesForUrls.name: Allow listed sites to connect to any HID device
WebHidAllowAllDevicesForUrls.summary: This setting allows you to list sites which are automatically granted permission to access all available devices.

WebHidAllowDevicesForUrls.name: Allow listed sites connect to specific HID devices
WebHidAllowDevicesForUrls.summary: This setting lets you list the URLs that specify which sites are automatically granted permission to access a HID device with the given vendor and product IDs.

WebHidAllowDevicesWithHidUsagesForUrls.name: Automatically grant permission to these sites to connect to HID devices containing top-level collections with the given HID usage
WebHidAllowDevicesWithHidUsagesForUrls.summary: This setting allows you to list the URLs that specify which sites are automatically granted permission to access a HID device containing a top-level collection with the given HID usage.

WebHidAskForUrls.name: Allow the WebHID API on these sites
WebHidAskForUrls.summary: Setting the policy lets you list the URL patterns that specify which sites can ask users to grant them access to a HID device.

WebHidBlockedForUrls.name: Block the WebHID API on these sites
WebHidBlockedForUrls.summary: Setting the policy lets you list the URL patterns that specify which sites can't ask users to grant them access to a HID device.

WebUsbAllowDevicesForUrls.name: Grant access to specific sites to connect to specific USB devices
WebUsbAllowDevicesForUrls.summary: Allows you to set a list of urls that specify which sites will automatically be granted permission to access a USB device with the given vendor and product IDs. Each item in the list must contain both devices and urls in order for the policy to be valid. Each item in devices can contain a vendor ID and product ID field. Any ID that is omitted is treated as a wildcard with one exception, and that exception is that a product ID cannot be specified without a vendor ID also being specified. Otherwise, the policy will not be valid and will be ignored.

WebUsbAskForUrls.name: Allow WebUSB on specific sites
WebUsbAskForUrls.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that can ask the user for access to a USB device.

WebUsbBlockedForUrls.name: Block WebUSB on specific sites
WebUsbBlockedForUrls.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that can't ask the user to grant them access to a USB device.

WindowManagementAllowedForUrls.name: Allow Window Management permission on specified sites
WindowManagementAllowedForUrls.summary: Lets you configure a list of site url patterns that specify sites which will automatically grant the window management permission. This extends the ability of sites to see information about the device's screens.  This information can be used to open and place windows or request fullscreen on specific screens.

WindowManagementBlockedForUrls.name: Block Window Management permission on specified sites
WindowManagementBlockedForUrls.summary: Lets you configure a list of site url patterns that specify sites which will automatically deny the window management permission. This limits the ability of sites to see information about the device's screens. This information can be used to open and place windows or request fullscreen on specific screens.

DefaultSearchProviderEnabled.name: Enable the default search provider
DefaultSearchProviderEnabled.summary: Enables the ability to use a default search provider.

DefaultSearchProviderEncodings.name: Default search provider encodings
DefaultSearchProviderEncodings.summary: Specify the character encodings supported by the search provider. Encodings are code page names like UTF-8, GB2312, and ISO-8859-1. They are tried in the order provided.

DefaultSearchProviderImageURL.name: Specifies the search-by-image feature for the default search provider
DefaultSearchProviderImageURL.summary: Specifies the URL to the search engine used for image search. Search requests are sent using the GET method.

DefaultSearchProviderImageURLPostParams.name: Parameters for an image URL that uses POST
DefaultSearchProviderImageURLPostParams.summary: If you enable this policy, it specifies the parameters used when an image search that uses POST is performed. The policy consists of comma-separated name/value pairs. If a value is a template parameter, like {imageThumbnail} in the preceding example, it's replaced with real image thumbnail data. This policy is applied only if you enable the [DefaultSearchProviderEnabled](#defaultsearchproviderenabled) and [DefaultSearchProviderSearchURL](#defaultsearchprovidersearchurl) policies.

DefaultSearchProviderKeyword.name: Default search provider keyword
DefaultSearchProviderKeyword.summary: Specifies the keyword, which is the shortcut used in the Address Bar to trigger the search for this provider.

DefaultSearchProviderName.name: Default search provider name
DefaultSearchProviderName.summary: Specifies the name of the default search provider.

DefaultSearchProviderSearchURL.name: Default search provider search URL
DefaultSearchProviderSearchURL.summary: Specifies the URL of the search engine used for a default search. The URL contains the string '{searchTerms}', which is replaced at query time by the terms the user is searching for.

DefaultSearchProviderSuggestURL.name: Default search provider URL for suggestions
DefaultSearchProviderSuggestURL.summary: Specifies the URL for the search engine used to provide search suggestions. The URL contains the string '{searchTerms}', which is replaced at query time by the text the user has entered so far.

NewTabPageSearchBox.name: Configure the new tab page search box experience
NewTabPageSearchBox.summary: You can configure the new tab page search box to use "Search box (Recommended)" or "Address bar" to search on new tabs. This policy only works if you set the search engine to a value other than Bing by setting the following two policies: [DefaultSearchProviderEnabled](#defaultsearchproviderenabled) and [DefaultSearchProviderSearchURL](#defaultsearchprovidersearchurl).

ShowDownloadsInsecureWarningsEnabled.name: Enable insecure download warnings
ShowDownloadsInsecureWarningsEnabled.summary: Enables warnings when potentially dangerous content is downloaded over HTTP.

PreventTyposquattingPromptOverride.name: Prevent bypassing Edge Website Typo Protection prompts for sites
PreventTyposquattingPromptOverride.summary: This policy setting lets you decide whether users can override the Edge Website Typo Protection warnings about potential typosquatting websites.

TyposquattingAllowListDomains.name: Configure the list of domains for which Edge Website Typo Protection won't trigger warnings
TyposquattingAllowListDomains.summary: Configure the list of Edge Website Typo Protection trusted domains. This means:

TyposquattingCheckerEnabled.name: Configure Edge Website Typo Protection
TyposquattingCheckerEnabled.summary: This policy setting lets you configure whether to turn on Edge Website Typo Protection. Edge Website Typo Protection provides warning messages to help protect your users from potential typosquatting sites. By default, Edge Website Typo Protection is turned on.

EdgeWorkspacesEnabled.name: Enable Workspaces
EdgeWorkspacesEnabled.summary: Microsoft Edge Workspaces helps improve productivity for users in your organization.

WorkspacesNavigationSettings.name: Configure navigation settings per groups of URLs in Microsoft Edge Workspaces
WorkspacesNavigationSettings.summary: This setting lets you to define groups of URLs, and apply specific Microsoft Edge Workspaces navigation settings to each group.

FeatureFlagOverridesControl.name: Configure users ability to override feature flags
FeatureFlagOverridesControl.summary: Configures users ability to override state of feature flags.

BlockExternalExtensions.name: Blocks external extensions from being installed
BlockExternalExtensions.summary: Control the installation of external extensions.

ControlDefaultStateOfAllowExtensionFromO.name: Configure default state of Allow extensions from other stores setting
ControlDefaultStateOfAllowExtensionFromO.summary: This policy allows you to control the default state of the Allow extensions from other stores setting.

ExtensionAllowedTypes.name: Configure allowed extension types
ExtensionAllowedTypes.summary: Setting the policy controls which apps and extensions may be installed in Microsoft Edge, which hosts they can interact with, and limits runtime access.

ExtensionDeveloperModeSettings.name: Control the availability of developer mode on extensions page
ExtensionDeveloperModeSettings.summary: Control if users can turn on Developer Mode on edge://extensions.

ExtensionExtendedBackgroundLifetimeForPo.name: Configure a list of origins that grant an extended background lifetime to connecting extensions.
ExtensionExtendedBackgroundLifetimeForPo.summary: Extensions that connect to one of these origins will keep running as long as the port is connected.

ExtensionInstallAllowlist.name: Allow specific extensions to be installed
ExtensionInstallAllowlist.summary: Setting this policy specifies which extensions are not subject to the blocklist.

ExtensionInstallBlocklist.name: Control which extensions cannot be installed
ExtensionInstallBlocklist.summary: Lets you specify which extensions the users CANNOT install. Extensions already installed will be disabled if blocked, without a way for the user to enable them. After a disabled extension is removed from the blocklist it will automatically get re-enabled.

ExtensionInstallForcelist.name: Control which extensions are installed silently
ExtensionInstallForcelist.summary: Set this policy to specify a list of apps and extensions that install silently, without user interaction. Users can't uninstall or turn off this setting. Permissions are granted implicitly, including the enterprise.deviceAttributes and enterprise.platformKeys extension APIs. Note: These 2 APIs aren't available to apps and extensions that aren't force-installed.

ExtensionInstallSources.name: Configure extension and user script install sources
ExtensionInstallSources.summary: Define URLs that can install extensions and themes.

ExtensionInstallTypeBlocklist.name: Blocklist for extension install types
ExtensionInstallTypeBlocklist.summary: The blocklist controls which extension install types are disallowed.

ExtensionManifestV2Availability.name: Control Manifest v2 extension availability
ExtensionManifestV2Availability.summary: Control if Manifest v2 extensions can be used by browser.

ExtensionSettings.name: Configure extension management settings
ExtensionSettings.summary: Setting this policy controls extension management settings for Microsoft Edge, including any controlled by existing extension-related policies. This policy supersedes any legacy policies that might be set.

GamerModeEnabled.name: Enable Gamer Mode
GamerModeEnabled.summary: Microsoft Edge Gamer Mode allows gamers to personalize their browser with gaming themes and gives them the option of enabling Efficiency Mode for PC gaming, the Gaming feed on new tabs, sidebar apps for gamers, and more.

GenAILocalFoundationalModelSettings.name: Settings for GenAI local foundational model
GenAILocalFoundationalModelSettings.summary: Configure how Microsoft Edge downloads the foundational GenAI model and uses it for inference locally.

AllHttpAuthSchemesAllowedForOrigins.name: List of origins that allow all HTTP authentication
AllHttpAuthSchemesAllowedForOrigins.summary: Set this policy to specify which origins allow all the HTTP authentication schemes Microsoft Edge supports regardless of the [AuthSchemes](#authschemes) policy.

AllowCrossOriginAuthPrompt.name: Allow cross-origin HTTP Authentication prompts
AllowCrossOriginAuthPrompt.summary: Controls whether third-party images on a page can show an authentication prompt.

AuthNegotiateDelegateAllowlist.name: Specifies a list of servers that Microsoft Edge can delegate user credentials to
AuthNegotiateDelegateAllowlist.summary: Configure the list of servers that Microsoft Edge can delegate to.

AuthSchemes.name: Supported authentication schemes
AuthSchemes.summary: Specifies which HTTP authentication schemes are supported.

AuthServerAllowlist.name: Configure list of allowed authentication servers
AuthServerAllowlist.summary: Specifies which servers to enable for integrated authentication. Integrated authentication is only enabled when Microsoft Edge receives an authentication challenge from a proxy or from a server in this list.

BasicAuthOverHttpEnabled.name: Allow Basic authentication for HTTP
BasicAuthOverHttpEnabled.summary: If you enable this policy or leave it unset, Basic authentication challenges received over non-secure HTTP will be allowed.

DisableAuthNegotiateCnameLookup.name: Disable CNAME lookup when negotiating Kerberos authentication
DisableAuthNegotiateCnameLookup.summary: Determines whether the generated Kerberos SPN is based on the canonical DNS name (CNAME) or on the original name entered.

EnableAuthNegotiatePort.name: Include non-standard port in Kerberos SPN
EnableAuthNegotiatePort.summary: Specifies whether the generated Kerberos SPN should include a non-standard port.

NtlmV2Enabled.name: Control whether NTLMv2 authentication is enabled

WindowsHelloForHTTPAuthEnabled.name: Windows Hello For HTTP Auth Enabled
WindowsHelloForHTTPAuthEnabled.summary: Indicates if Windows Credential UI should be used to respond to NTLM and Negotiate authentication challenges.

AutomaticProfileSwitchingSiteList.name: Configure the automatic profile switching site list
AutomaticProfileSwitchingSiteList.summary: Set this policy to control which profiles Microsoft Edge will use to open sites in. Switching configurations for sites listed in this policy take precedence over other heuristics Microsoft Edge uses for switching sites but note that sites not listed on this policy are still subject to switching by those heuristics. If this policy is not configured, Microsoft Edge will continue using its heuristics to automatically switch sites.

EdgeDefaultProfileEnabled.name: Default Profile Setting Enabled
EdgeDefaultProfileEnabled.summary: Configuring this policy will let you set a default profile in Microsoft Edge to be used when opening the browser rather than the last profile used. This policy won't affect when "--profile-directory" parameter has been specified. Set the value to "Default" to refer to the default profile. The value is case sensitive.

GuidedSwitchEnabled.name: Guided Switch Enabled
GuidedSwitchEnabled.summary: Allows Microsoft Edge to prompt the user to switch to the appropriate profile when Microsoft Edge detects that a link is a personal or work link.

ImplicitSignInEnabled.name: Enable implicit sign-in
ImplicitSignInEnabled.summary: Configure this policy to allow/disallow implicit sign-in.

LinkedAccountEnabled.name: Enable the linked account feature
LinkedAccountEnabled.summary: Microsoft Edge guides a user to the account management page where they can link a Microsoft Account (MSA) to an Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) account.

OneAuthAuthenticationEnforced.name: OneAuth Authentication Flow Enforced for signin
OneAuthAuthenticationEnforced.summary: This policy allows users to decide whether to use the OneAuth library for sign-in and token fetch in Microsoft Edge on Windows 10 RS3 and above.

OnlyOnPremisesImplicitSigninEnabled.name: Only on-premises account enabled for implicit sign-in
OnlyOnPremisesImplicitSigninEnabled.summary: Configure this policy to decide whether only on-premises accounts are enabled for implicit sign-in.

ProactiveAuthWorkflowEnabled.name: Enable proactive authentication
ProactiveAuthWorkflowEnabled.summary: This policy controls the proactive authentication in Microsoft Edge, that connects the signed-in user identity with Microsoft Bing, MSN and Copilot services for a smooth and consistent sign-in experience.

SignInCtaOnNtpEnabled.name: Enable sign in click to action dialog (obsolete)
SignInCtaOnNtpEnabled.summary: Configure this policy to show sign in click to action dialog on New tab page.

SwitchIntranetSitesToWorkProfile.name: Switch intranet sites to a work profile
SwitchIntranetSitesToWorkProfile.summary: Allows Microsoft Edge to switch to the appropriate profile when Microsoft Edge detects that a URL is the intranet.

SwitchSitesOnIEModeSiteListToWorkProfile.name: Switch sites on the IE mode site list to a work profile
SwitchSitesOnIEModeSiteListToWorkProfile.summary: Allows Microsoft Edge to switch to the appropriate profile when navigating to a site that matches an entry on the IE mode site list. Only sites that specify IE mode or Edge mode will be switched to the work profile.

WAMAuthBelowWin10RS3Enabled.name: WAM for authentication below Windows 10 RS3 enabled
WAMAuthBelowWin10RS3Enabled.summary: Configure this policy to decide whether WAM is used for authentication in Microsoft Edge on Windows 10 RS1 and RS2.

ImmersiveReaderGrammarToolsEnabled.name: Enable Grammar Tools feature within Immersive Reader in Microsoft Edge (obsolete)
ImmersiveReaderGrammarToolsEnabled.summary: This policy is obsoleted because Grammar Tools is deprecated from Edge. This policy won't work in Microsoft Edge version 126. Enables the Grammar Tools feature within Immersive Reader in Microsoft Edge.

ImmersiveReaderPictureDictionaryEnabled.name: Enable Picture Dictionary feature within Immersive Reader in Microsoft Edge (obsolete)
ImmersiveReaderPictureDictionaryEnabled.summary: This Policy is obsoleted because Picture Dictionary is deprecated from Edge as of Sept, 2023. This policy won't work in Microsoft Edge Version 127. Enables the Picture Dictionary feature within Immersive Reader in Microsoft Edge.

KioskAddressBarEditingEnabled.name: Configure address bar editing for kiosk mode public browsing experience
KioskAddressBarEditingEnabled.summary: This policy only applies to Microsoft Edge kiosk mode while using the public browsing experience.

KioskDeleteDownloadsOnExit.name: Delete files downloaded as part of kiosk session when Microsoft Edge closes
KioskDeleteDownloadsOnExit.summary: This policy only applies to Microsoft Edge kiosk mode.

KioskSwipeGesturesEnabled.name: Swipe gestures in Microsoft Edge kiosk mode enabled
KioskSwipeGesturesEnabled.summary: This policy only applies to Microsoft Edge kiosk mode.

EdgeManagementEnabled.name: Microsoft Edge management enabled
EdgeManagementEnabled.summary: Microsoft Edge management service in Microsoft 365 Admin Center lets you set policy and manage users through a Microsoft Edge focused cloud-based management experience. This policy lets you control whether Microsoft Edge management is enabled.

EdgeManagementEnrollmentToken.name: Microsoft Edge management enrollment token
EdgeManagementEnrollmentToken.summary: Microsoft Edge management service in Microsoft 365 Admin Center lets you set policy and manage users through a Microsoft Edge focused cloud-based management experience. This policy lets you specify an enrollment token that's used to register with Microsoft Edge management service and deploy the associated policies. The user must be signed into Microsoft Edge with a valid work or school account otherwise Microsoft Edge will not download the policy.

EdgeManagementExtensionsFeedbackEnabled.name: Microsoft Edge management extensions feedback enabled
EdgeManagementExtensionsFeedbackEnabled.summary: This setting controls whether Microsoft Edge sends data about blocked extensions to the Microsoft Edge management service.

EdgeManagementPolicyOverridesPlatformPol.name: Microsoft Edge management service policy overrides platform policy.
EdgeManagementPolicyOverridesPlatformPol.summary: If you enable this policy, the cloud-based Microsoft Edge management service policy takes precedence if it conflicts with platform policy.

EdgeManagementUserPolicyOverridesCloudMa.name: Allow cloud-based Microsoft Edge management service user policies to override local user policies.
EdgeManagementUserPolicyOverridesCloudMa.summary: If you enable this policy, cloud-based Microsoft Edge management service user policies takes precedence if it conflicts with local user policy.

MAMEnabled.name: Mobile App Management Enabled
MAMEnabled.summary: Allows the Microsoft Edge browser to retrieve policies from the Intune application management services and apply them to users' profiles.

NativeMessagingAllowlist.name: Control which native messaging hosts users can use
NativeMessagingAllowlist.summary: Setting the policy specifies which native messaging hosts aren't subject to the deny list. A deny list value of * means all native messaging hosts are denied unless they're explicitly allowed.

NativeMessagingBlocklist.name: Configure native messaging block list
NativeMessagingBlocklist.summary: Setting this policy specifies which native messaging hosts shouldn't be loaded. A deny list value of * means all native messaging hosts are denied unless they're explicitly allowed.

NativeMessagingUserLevelHosts.name: Allow user-level native messaging hosts (installed without admin permissions)
NativeMessagingUserLevelHosts.summary: If you set this policy to Enabled or leave it unset, Microsoft Edge can use native messaging hosts installed at the user level.

AccessControlAllowMethodsInCORSPreflight.name: Make Access-Control-Allow-Methods matching in CORS preflight spec conformant
AccessControlAllowMethodsInCORSPreflight.summary: This policy controls whether request methods are uppercased when matching with Access-Control-Allow-Methods response headers in CORS preflight.

BlockTruncatedCookies.name: Block truncated cookies (obsolete)
BlockTruncatedCookies.summary: This policy provides a temporary opt-out for changes to how Microsoft Edge handles cookies set via JavaScript that contain certain control characters (NULL, carriage return, and line feed).

CompressionDictionaryTransportEnabled.name: Enable compression dictionary transport support
CompressionDictionaryTransportEnabled.summary: This feature enables the use of dictionary-specific content encodings in the Accept-Encoding request header ("sbr" and "zst-d") when dictionaries are available for use.

DataURLWhitespacePreservationEnabled.name: DataURL Whitespace Preservation for all media types
DataURLWhitespacePreservationEnabled.summary: This policy provides a temporary opt-out for changes to how Edge handles whitepsace in data URLS.

IPv6ReachabilityOverrideEnabled.name: Enable IPv6 reachability check override
IPv6ReachabilityOverrideEnabled.summary: This policy enables an override of the IPv6 reachability check. When overridden, the

ZstdContentEncodingEnabled.name: Enable zstd content encoding support
ZstdContentEncodingEnabled.summary: This feature enables advertising "zstd" support in the Accept-Encoding request header and support for decompressing zstd web content.

ViewXFAPDFInIEModeAllowedFileHash.name: View XFA-based PDF files using IE Mode for allowed file hash.
ViewXFAPDFInIEModeAllowedFileHash.summary: XFA is a legacy technology that is deprecated by its original creators. It is not an ISO standard and as such, doesn't align with the modern web architecture. Continued use poses potential risks and vulnerabilities. For more information, see - [ViewXFAPDFInIEModeAllowedOrigins](#viewxfapdfiniemodeallowedorigins).

ViewXFAPDFInIEModeAllowedOrigins.name: View XFA-based PDF files using IE Mode for allowed file origin.
ViewXFAPDFInIEModeAllowedOrigins.summary: Internet Explorer (IE) mode uses the Adobe Acrobat Active-X PDF Plugin to open XFA-based PDF files. This policy will only work if the Active-X plugin is already on the user's device, it's not installed as part of this policy.

DeletingUndecryptablePasswordsEnabled.name: Enable deleting undecryptable passwords
DeletingUndecryptablePasswordsEnabled.summary: This policy controls whether the built-in password manager can delete undecryptable passwords from its database. This is required to restore the full functionality of the built-in password manager, but it may include a permanent data loss. Undecryptable password values will not become decryptable on their own.

PasswordDeleteOnBrowserCloseEnabled.name: Prevent passwords from being deleted if any Edge settings is enabled to delete browsing data when Microsoft Edge closes
PasswordDeleteOnBrowserCloseEnabled.summary: When this policy is enabled, the passwords saved with Edge Password Manager are exempted from deletion when the browser closes. This policy is only effective when the [ClearBrowsingDataOnExit](#clearbrowsingdataonexit) policy is enabled.

PasswordGeneratorEnabled.name: Allow users to get a strong password suggestion whenever they are creating an account online
PasswordGeneratorEnabled.summary: Configures the Password Generator Settings toggle that enables/disables the feature for users.

PasswordManagerBlocklist.name: Configure the list of domains for which the password manager UI (Save and Fill) will be disabled
PasswordManagerBlocklist.summary: Configure the list of domains where Microsoft Edge should disable the password manager. This means that Save and Fill workflows will be disabled, ensuring that passwords for those websites can't be saved or auto filled into web forms.

PasswordManagerEnabled.name: Enable saving passwords to the password manager
PasswordManagerEnabled.summary: Enable Microsoft Edge to save user passwords. The next time a user visits a site with a saved password, Microsoft Edge will enter the password automatically.

PasswordManagerRestrictLengthEnabled.name: Restrict the length of passwords that can be saved in the Password Manager
PasswordManagerRestrictLengthEnabled.summary: Make Microsoft Edge restrict the length of usernames and/or passwords that can be saved in the Password Manager.

PasswordMonitorAllowed.name: Allow users to be alerted if their passwords are found to be unsafe
PasswordMonitorAllowed.summary: Allow Microsoft Edge to monitor user passwords.

PasswordProtectionChangePasswordURL.name: Configure the change password URL
PasswordProtectionChangePasswordURL.summary: Configures the change password URL (HTTP and HTTPS schemes only).

PasswordProtectionLoginURLs.name: Configure the list of enterprise login URLs where the password protection service should capture salted hashes of a password
PasswordProtectionLoginURLs.summary: Configure the list of enterprise login URLs (HTTP and HTTPS schemes only) where Microsoft Edge should capture the salted hashes of passwords and use it for password reuse detection.

PasswordProtectionWarningTrigger.name: Configure password protection warning trigger
PasswordProtectionWarningTrigger.summary: Allows you to control when to trigger password protection warning. Password protection alerts users when they reuse their protected password on potentially suspicious sites.

PasswordRevealEnabled.name: Enable Password reveal button
PasswordRevealEnabled.summary: Lets you configure the default display of the browser password reveal button for password input fields on websites.

PrimaryPasswordSetting.name: Configures a setting that asks users to enter their device password while using password autofill
PrimaryPasswordSetting.summary: The feature helps users add an additional layer of privacy to their online accounts by requiring device authentication (as a way of confirming the user's identity) before the saved password is auto-filled into a web form. This ensures that non-authorized persons can't use saved passwords for autofill.

EfficiencyMode.name: Configure when efficiency mode should become active
EfficiencyMode.summary: This policy setting lets you configure when efficiency mode will become active. By default, efficiency mode is set to 'BalancedSavings'. On devices with no battery, the default is for efficiency mode to never become active.

EfficiencyModeEnabled.name: Efficiency mode enabled
EfficiencyModeEnabled.summary: Enables efficiency mode which helps extend battery life by saving computer resources. By default, efficiency mode is enabled for devices with a battery and disabled otherwise.

EfficiencyModeOnPowerEnabled.name: Enable efficiency mode when the device is connected to a power source
EfficiencyModeOnPowerEnabled.summary: Allows efficiency mode to become active when the device is connected to a power source. On devices with no battery, this policy has no effect.

ExtensionsPerformanceDetectorEnabled.name: Extensions Performance Detector enabled
ExtensionsPerformanceDetectorEnabled.summary: This policy controls if users can access the Extensions Performance Detector Recommended Action feature in Browser Essentials. This feature alerts extension users if their extensions are causing performance regressions in the browser and allows them to take action to resolve the issue.

PerformanceDetectorEnabled.name: Performance Detector Enabled
PerformanceDetectorEnabled.summary: The performance detector detects tab performance issues and recommends actions to fix the performance issues.

PinBrowserEssentialsToolbarButton.name: Pin browser essentials toolbar button
PinBrowserEssentialsToolbarButton.summary: This policy lets you configure whether to pin the Browser essentials button on the toolbar.

StartupBoostEnabled.name: Enable startup boost
StartupBoostEnabled.summary: Allows Microsoft Edge processes to start at OS sign-in and restart in background after the last browser window is closed.

SameOriginTabCaptureAllowedByOrigins.name: Allow Same Origin Tab capture by these origins
SameOriginTabCaptureAllowedByOrigins.summary: Setting the policy lets you set a list of URL patterns that can capture tabs with their same Origin.

ScreenCaptureAllowedByOrigins.name: Allow Desktop, Window, and Tab capture by these origins
ScreenCaptureAllowedByOrigins.summary: Setting the policy lets you set a list of URL patterns that can use Desktop, Window, and Tab Capture.

TabCaptureAllowedByOrigins.name: Allow Tab capture by these origins
TabCaptureAllowedByOrigins.summary: Setting the policy lets you set a list of URL patterns that can use Tab Capture.

WindowCaptureAllowedByOrigins.name: Allow Window and Tab capture by these origins
WindowCaptureAllowedByOrigins.summary: Setting the policy lets you set a list of URL patterns that can use Window and Tab Capture.

DefaultPrinterSelection.name: Default printer selection rules
DefaultPrinterSelection.summary: Overrides Microsoft Edge default printer selection rules. This policy determines the rules for selecting the default printer in Microsoft Edge, which happens the first time a user tries to print a page.

PrintHeaderFooter.name: Print headers and footers
PrintHeaderFooter.summary: Force 'headers and footers' to be on or off in the printing dialog.

PrintPdfAsImageDefault.name: Print PDF as Image Default
PrintPdfAsImageDefault.summary: Controls if Microsoft Edge makes the Print as image option the default when printing PDFs.

PrintPostScriptMode.name: Print PostScript Mode
PrintPostScriptMode.summary: Controls how Microsoft Edge prints on Microsoft Windows.

PrintPreviewStickySettings.name: Configure the sticky print preview settings
PrintPreviewStickySettings.summary: Configuring this policy sets the print preview settings as the most recent choice in Print Preview instead of the default print preview settings.

PrintPreviewUseSystemDefaultPrinter.name: Set the system default printer as the default printer
PrintPreviewUseSystemDefaultPrinter.summary: Tells Microsoft Edge to use the system default printer as the default choice in Print Preview instead of the most recently used printer.

PrintRasterizationMode.name: Print Rasterization Mode
PrintRasterizationMode.summary: Controls how Microsoft Edge prints on Windows.

PrintRasterizePdfDpi.name: Print Rasterize PDF DPI
PrintRasterizePdfDpi.summary: Controls print image resolution when Microsoft Edge prints PDFs with rasterization.

PrintStickySettings.name: Print preview sticky settings
PrintStickySettings.summary: Specifies whether print preview should apply last used settings for Microsoft Edge PDF and webpages.

PrinterTypeDenyList.name: Disable printer types on the deny list
PrinterTypeDenyList.summary: The printer types on the deny list won't be discovered or have their capabilities fetched.

PrintingAllowedBackgroundGraphicsModes.name: Restrict background graphics printing mode
PrintingAllowedBackgroundGraphicsModes.summary: Restricts background graphics printing mode. If this policy isn't set there's no restriction on printing background graphics.

PrintingBackgroundGraphicsDefault.name: Default background graphics printing mode
PrintingBackgroundGraphicsDefault.summary: Overrides the last used setting for printing background graphics.

PrintingEnabled.name: Enable printing
PrintingEnabled.summary: Enables printing in Microsoft Edge and prevents users from changing this setting.

PrintingLPACSandboxEnabled.name: Enable Printing LPAC Sandbox
PrintingLPACSandboxEnabled.summary: Setting this policy to Enabled or leaving it unset enables the LPAC Sandbox for printing services when the system configuration supports it.

PrintingWebpageLayout.name: Sets layout for printing
PrintingWebpageLayout.summary: Configuring  this   policy  sets  the  layout  for  printing  webpages.

UseSystemPrintDialog.name: Print using system print dialog
UseSystemPrintDialog.summary: Shows the system print dialog instead of print preview.

InsecurePrivateNetworkRequestsAllowed.name: Specifies whether to allow websites to make requests to any network endpoint in an insecure manner.
InsecurePrivateNetworkRequestsAllowed.summary: Controls whether websites are allowed to make requests to more-private network endpoints.

InsecurePrivateNetworkRequestsAllowedFor.name: Allow the listed sites to make requests to more-private network endpoints from in an insecure manner
InsecurePrivateNetworkRequestsAllowedFor.summary: List of URL patterns. Requests initiated from websites served by matching origins are not subject to Private Network Access checks.

PrivateNetworkAccessRestrictionsEnabled.name: Specifies whether to apply restrictions to requests to more private network endpoints
PrivateNetworkAccessRestrictionsEnabled.summary: Specifies whether to apply restrictions to requests to more private

ProxyBypassList.name: Configure proxy bypass rules (deprecated)
ProxyBypassList.summary: This policy is deprecated, use [ProxySettings](#proxysettings) instead. It won't work in Microsoft Edge version 91.

ProxyMode.name: Configure proxy server settings (deprecated)
ProxyMode.summary: This policy is deprecated, use [ProxySettings](#proxysettings) instead. It won't work in Microsoft Edge version 91.

ProxyPacUrl.name: Set the proxy .pac file URL (deprecated)
ProxyPacUrl.summary: This policy is deprecated, use [ProxySettings](#proxysettings) instead. It won't work in Microsoft Edge version 91.

ProxyServer.name: Configure address or URL of proxy server (deprecated)
ProxyServer.summary: This policy is deprecated, use [ProxySettings](#proxysettings) instead. It won't work in Microsoft Edge version 91.

ProxySettings.name: Proxy settings
ProxySettings.summary: Configures the proxy settings for Microsoft Edge.

RelatedWebsiteSetsEnabled.name: Enable Related Website Sets
RelatedWebsiteSetsEnabled.summary: This policy lets you control the enablement of the Related Website Sets feature. Related Website Sets (RWS) is a way for an organisation to declare relationships among sites, so that Microsoft Edge allows limited third-party cookie access for specific purposes across those sites.

RelatedWebsiteSetsOverrides.name: Override Related Website Sets.
RelatedWebsiteSetsOverrides.summary: This policy provides a way to override the list of sets Microsoft Edge uses for Related Website Sets

AutoDiscardSleepingTabsEnabled.name: Configure auto discard sleeping tabs
AutoDiscardSleepingTabsEnabled.summary: Setting this policy enables inactive (sleeping) tabs to be automatically discarded after 1.5 days of inactivity. This is done to save memory. When the user switches back to a discarded tab, the tab will need to be reloaded.

SleepingTabsBlockedForUrls.name: Block sleeping tabs on specific sites
SleepingTabsBlockedForUrls.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that are not allowed to be put to sleep by sleeping tabs. Sites in this list are also excluded from other performance optimizations like efficiency mode and tab discard.

SleepingTabsEnabled.name: Configure sleeping tabs
SleepingTabsEnabled.summary: This policy setting lets you configure whether to turn on sleeping tabs. Sleeping tabs reduces CPU, battery, and memory usage by putting idle background tabs to sleep. Microsoft Edge uses heuristics to avoid putting tabs to sleep that do useful work in the background, such as display notifications, play sound, and stream video. By default, sleeping tabs is turned on.

SleepingTabsTimeout.name: Set the background tab inactivity timeout for sleeping tabs
SleepingTabsTimeout.summary: This policy setting lets you configure the timeout, in seconds, after which inactive background tabs will be automatically put to sleep if sleeping tabs is enabled. By default, this timeout is 7,200 seconds (2 hours).

ExemptSmartScreenDownloadWarnings.name: Disable SmartScreen AppRep based warnings for specified file types on specified domains
ExemptSmartScreenDownloadWarnings.summary: You can enable this policy to create a dictionary of file type extensions with a corresponding list of domains that will be exempted from SmartScreen AppRep warnings. For example, if  the "vbe" extension is associated with "website1.com", users would not see a SmartScreen AppRep warning when downloading "vbe" files from "website1.com", but may see a download warning when downloading "vbe" files from "website2.com".

NewSmartScreenLibraryEnabled.name: Enable new SmartScreen library (obsolete)
NewSmartScreenLibraryEnabled.summary: This policy doesn't work because it was only intended to be a short-term mechanism to support the update to a new SmartScreen client.

PreventSmartScreenPromptOverride.name: Prevent bypassing Microsoft Defender SmartScreen prompts for sites
PreventSmartScreenPromptOverride.summary: This policy setting lets you decide whether users can override the Microsoft Defender SmartScreen warnings about potentially malicious websites.

PreventSmartScreenPromptOverrideForFiles.name: Prevent bypassing of Microsoft Defender SmartScreen warnings about downloads
PreventSmartScreenPromptOverrideForFiles.summary: This policy lets you determine whether users can override Microsoft Defender SmartScreen warnings about unverified downloads.

SmartScreenAllowListDomains.name: Configure the list of domains for which Microsoft Defender SmartScreen won't trigger warnings
SmartScreenAllowListDomains.summary: Configure the list of Microsoft Defender SmartScreen trusted domains. This means:

SmartScreenDnsRequestsEnabled.name: Enable Microsoft Defender SmartScreen DNS requests
SmartScreenDnsRequestsEnabled.summary: This policy lets you configure whether to enable DNS requests made by Microsoft Defender SmartScreen. Note: Disabling DNS requests will prevent Microsoft Defender SmartScreen from getting IP addresses, and potentially impact the IP-based protections provided.

SmartScreenEnabled.name: Configure Microsoft Defender SmartScreen
SmartScreenEnabled.summary: This policy setting lets you configure whether to turn on Microsoft Defender SmartScreen. Microsoft Defender SmartScreen provides warning messages to help protect your users from potential phishing scams and malicious software. By default, Microsoft Defender SmartScreen is turned on.

SmartScreenForTrustedDownloadsEnabled.name: Force Microsoft Defender SmartScreen checks on downloads from trusted sources
SmartScreenForTrustedDownloadsEnabled.summary: This policy setting lets you configure whether Microsoft Defender SmartScreen checks download reputation from a trusted source.

SmartScreenPuaEnabled.name: Configure Microsoft Defender SmartScreen to block potentially unwanted apps
SmartScreenPuaEnabled.summary: This policy setting lets you configure whether to turn on blocking for potentially unwanted apps with Microsoft Defender SmartScreen. Potentially unwanted app blocking with Microsoft Defender SmartScreen provides warning messages to help protect users from adware, coin miners, bundleware, and other low-reputation apps that are hosted by websites. Potentially unwanted app blocking with Microsoft Defender SmartScreen is turned off by default.

Startup, home page and new tab page.name: Startup, home page and new tab page

AADWebSiteSSOUsingThisProfileEnabled.name: Single sign-on for work or school sites using this profile enabled
AADWebSiteSSOUsingThisProfileEnabled.summary: 'Allow single sign-on for work or school sites using this profile' option allows non-AAD profiles to be able to use single sign-on for work or school sites using work or school credentials present on the machine. This option shows up for end-users as a toggle in Settings -> Profiles -> Profile Preferences for non-AAD profiles only.

AIGenThemesEnabled.name: Enables DALL-E themes generation
AIGenThemesEnabled.summary: This policy lets you generate browser themes using DALL-E and apply them to Microsoft Edge.

AccessibilityImageLabelsEnabled.name: Let screen reader users get image descriptions from Microsoft
AccessibilityImageLabelsEnabled.summary: Lets screen reader users get descriptions of unlabeled images on the web.

AdHocCodeSigningForPWAsEnabled.name: Native application signing during Progressive Web Application installation
AdHocCodeSigningForPWAsEnabled.summary: Enabling this policy or leaving it unset enables the use of ad-hoc signatures for the native application that's created when installing a Progressive Web Application (PWA). This ensures that each installed application has a unique identity to macOS system components.

AdditionalSearchBoxEnabled.name: Enable additional search box in browser
AdditionalSearchBoxEnabled.summary: A search box is an additional text input field located next to the address bar in a web browser. It allows users to perform web searches directly from the browser interface.

AddressBarEditingEnabled.name: Configure address bar editing
AddressBarEditingEnabled.summary: If you enable or don't configure this policy, users can change the URL in the address bar.

AddressBarMicrosoftSearchInBingProviderE.name: Enable Microsoft Search in Bing suggestions in the address bar
AddressBarMicrosoftSearchInBingProviderE.summary: Enables the display of relevant Microsoft Search in Bing suggestions in the address bar's suggestion list when the user types a search string in the address bar. If you enable or don't configure this policy, users can see internal results powered by Microsoft Search in Bing in the Microsoft Edge address bar suggestion list. To see the Microsoft Search in Bing results, the user must be signed into Microsoft Edge with their Azure AD account for that organization.

AdsSettingForIntrusiveAdsSites.name: Ads setting for sites with intrusive ads
AdsSettingForIntrusiveAdsSites.summary: Controls whether ads are blocked on sites with intrusive ads.

AdsTransparencyEnabled.name: Configure if the ads transparency feature is enabled
AdsTransparencyEnabled.summary: Lets you decide whether the ads transparency feature is enabled. This behavior only applies to the "balanced" mode of tracking prevention, and does not impact "basic" or "strict" modes. Your users' tracking prevention level can be configured using the [TrackingPrevention](#trackingprevention) policy. AdsTransparencyEnabled will only have an effect if [TrackingPrevention](#trackingprevention) is set to TrackingPreventionBalanced or is not configured.

AllowBackForwardCacheForCacheControlNoSt.name: Allow pages with Cache-Control: no-store header to enter back/forward cache
AllowBackForwardCacheForCacheControlNoSt.summary: This policy controls if a page with Cache-Control: no-store header can be stored in back/forward cache. The website setting this header may not expect the page to be restored from back/forward cache since some sensitive information could still be displayed after the restoration even if it is no longer accessible.

AllowDeletingBrowserHistory.name: Enable deleting browser and download history
AllowDeletingBrowserHistory.summary: Enables deleting browser history and download history and prevents users from changing this setting.

AllowFileSelectionDialogs.name: Allow file selection dialogs
AllowFileSelectionDialogs.summary: Allow access to local files by letting Microsoft Edge display file selection dialogs.

AllowGamesMenu.name: Allow users to access the games menu (deprecated)
AllowGamesMenu.summary: This policy is deprecated because it can be managed using the [HubsSidebarEnabled](#hubssidebarenabled) policy.

AllowPopupsDuringPageUnload.name: Allows a page to show popups during its unloading (obsolete)
AllowPopupsDuringPageUnload.summary: This policy allows an admin to specify that a page can show popups during its unloading.

AllowSurfGame.name: Allow surf game
AllowSurfGame.summary: If you disable this policy, users won't be able to play the surf game when the device is offline or if the user navigates to edge://surf.

AllowSyncXHRInPageDismissal.name: Allow pages to send synchronous XHR requests during page dismissal (obsolete)
AllowSyncXHRInPageDismissal.summary: This policy is obsolete because it was only intended to be a short-term mechanism to give enterprises more time to update their web content if and when it was found to be incompatible with the change to disallow synchronous XHR requests during page dismissal. It doesn't work in Microsoft Edge after version 99.

AllowSystemNotifications.name: Allows system notifications
AllowSystemNotifications.summary: Lets you use system notifications instead of Microsoft Edge's embedded Message Center on Windows and Linux.

AllowTokenBindingForUrls.name: Configure the list of sites for which Microsoft Edge will attempt to establish a Token Binding with (obsolete)
AllowTokenBindingForUrls.summary: This policy is obsolete because Token Binding is no longer supported, starting with Microsoft Edge 130.

AllowTrackingForUrls.name: Configure tracking prevention exceptions for specific sites
AllowTrackingForUrls.summary: Configure the list of URL patterns that are excluded from tracking prevention.

AllowWebAuthnWithBrokenTlsCerts.name: Allow Web Authentication requests on sites with broken TLS certificates.
AllowWebAuthnWithBrokenTlsCerts.summary: If you enable this policy, Microsoft Edge will allow Web Authentication requests on websites that have TLS certificates with errors (i.e. websites considered not secure).

AllowedDomainsForApps.name: Define domains allowed to access Google Workspace
AllowedDomainsForApps.summary: Setting the policy on Microsoft Edge turns on the restricted sign-in feature in Google Workspace and prevents users from changing this setting. Users can only access Google tools using accounts from the specified domains. To allow gmail or googlemail accounts, add consumer_accounts to the list of domains. This policy is based on the Chrome policy of the same name.

AlternateErrorPagesEnabled.name: Suggest similar pages when a webpage can't be found
AlternateErrorPagesEnabled.summary: Allow Microsoft Edge to issue a connection to a web service to generate URL and search suggestions for connectivity issues such as DNS errors.

AlwaysOpenPdfExternally.name: Always open PDF files externally
AlwaysOpenPdfExternally.summary: Disables the internal PDF viewer in Microsoft Edge.

AmbientAuthenticationInPrivateModesEnabl.name: Enable Ambient Authentication for InPrivate and Guest profiles
AmbientAuthenticationInPrivateModesEnabl.summary: Configure this policy to allow/disallow ambient authentication for InPrivate and Guest profiles in Microsoft Edge.

AppCacheForceEnabled.name: Allows the AppCache feature to be re-enabled, even if it's turned off by default (obsolete)
AppCacheForceEnabled.summary: Support for AppCache and this policy was removed from Microsoft Edge starting in version 97.

ApplicationBoundEncryptionEnabled.name: Enable Application Bound Encryption
ApplicationBoundEncryptionEnabled.summary: Enabling this policy or leaving it unset binds the encryption keys used for local data storage to Microsoft Edge whenever possible.

ApplicationLocaleValue.name: Set application locale
ApplicationLocaleValue.summary: Configures the application locale in Microsoft Edge and prevents users from changing the locale.

AskBeforeCloseEnabled.name: Get user confirmation before closing a browser window with multiple tabs
AskBeforeCloseEnabled.summary: This policy lets you configure whether users see a confirmation dialog before closing a browser window with multiple tabs. This dialog asks users to confirm that the browser window can be closed.

AudioCaptureAllowed.name: Allow or block audio capture
AudioCaptureAllowed.summary: Allows you to set whether a user is prompted to grant a website access to their audio capture device. This policy applies to all URLs except for those configured in the [AudioCaptureAllowedUrls](#audiocaptureallowedurls) list.

AudioCaptureAllowedUrls.name: Sites that can access audio capture devices without requesting permission
AudioCaptureAllowedUrls.summary: Specify websites, based on URL patterns, that can use audio capture devices without asking the user for permission. Patterns in this list are matched against the security origin of the requesting URL. If they match, the site is automatically granted access to audio capture devices. Note, however, that the pattern "*", which matches any URL, is not supported by this policy.

AudioProcessHighPriorityEnabled.name: Allow the audio process to run with priority above normal on Windows
AudioProcessHighPriorityEnabled.summary: This policy controls the priority of the audio process on Windows.

AudioSandboxEnabled.name: Allow the audio sandbox to run
AudioSandboxEnabled.summary: This policy controls the audio process sandbox.

AutoImportAtFirstRun.name: Automatically import another browser's data and settings at first run
AutoImportAtFirstRun.summary: If you enable this policy, all supported datatypes and settings from the specified browser will be silently and automatically imported at first run. During the First Run Experience, the import section will also be skipped.

AutoLaunchProtocolsComponentEnabled.name: AutoLaunch Protocols Component Enabled
AutoLaunchProtocolsComponentEnabled.summary: Specifies whether the AutoLaunch Protocols component should be enabled. This component allows Microsoft to provide a list similar to that of the [AutoLaunchProtocolsFromOrigins](#autolaunchprotocolsfromorigins) policy, allowing certain external protocols to launch without prompt or blocking certain protocols (on specified origins). By default, this component is enabled.

AutoLaunchProtocolsFromOrigins.name: Define a list of protocols that can launch an external application from listed origins without prompting the user
AutoLaunchProtocolsFromOrigins.summary: Allows you to set a list of protocols, and for each protocol an associated list of allowed origin patterns, that can launch an external application without prompting the user. The trailing separator should not be included when listing the protocol and the protocol should be all lower case. For example, list "skype" instead of "skype:", "skype://" or "Skype".

AutoOpenAllowedForURLs.name: URLs where AutoOpenFileTypes can apply
AutoOpenAllowedForURLs.summary: A list of URLs to which [AutoOpenFileTypes](#autoopenfiletypes) will apply to. This policy has no impact on automatically open values set by users via the download shelf ... > "Always open files of this type" menu entry.

AutoOpenFileTypes.name: List of file types that should be automatically opened on download
AutoOpenFileTypes.summary: This policy sets a list of file types that should be automatically opened on download. Note: The leading separator should not be included when listing the file type, so list "txt" instead of ".txt".

AutofillAddressEnabled.name: Enable AutoFill for addresses
AutofillAddressEnabled.summary: Enables the AutoFill feature and allows users to auto-complete address information in web forms using previously stored information.

AutofillCreditCardEnabled.name: Enable AutoFill for payment instruments
AutofillCreditCardEnabled.summary: Enables Microsoft Edge's AutoFill feature and lets users auto complete payment instruments like credit or debit cards in web forms using previously stored information. This includes suggesting new payment instruments like Buy Now Pay Later (BNPL) in web forms and Express Checkout.

AutofillMembershipsEnabled.name: Save and fill memberships
AutofillMembershipsEnabled.summary: This policy lets you decide whether users can have their membership info (for example, program name and membership number) automatically saved and used to fill form fields while using Microsoft Edge. By default, users can choose whether to enable it or not.

AutomaticHttpsDefault.name: Configure Automatic HTTPS
AutomaticHttpsDefault.summary: This policy lets you manage settings for [AutomaticHttpsDefault](#automatichttpsdefault), which switches connections from HTTP to HTTPS.

AutoplayAllowed.name: Allow media autoplay for websites
AutoplayAllowed.summary: This policy sets the media autoplay policy for websites.

AutoplayAllowlist.name: Allow media autoplay on specific sites
AutoplayAllowlist.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that are allowed to autoplay media.

BackgroundModeEnabled.name: Continue running background apps after Microsoft Edge closes
BackgroundModeEnabled.summary: Allows Microsoft Edge processes to start at OS sign-in and keep running after the last browser window is closed. In this scenario, background apps and the current browsing session remain active, including any session cookies. An open background process displays an icon in the system tray and can always be closed from there.

BackgroundTemplateListUpdatesEnabled.name: Enables background updates to the list of available templates for Collections and other features that use templates (deprecated)
BackgroundTemplateListUpdatesEnabled.summary: This policy is deprecated because we are moving to a new policy. It won't work in Microsoft Edge as soon as version 104. The new policy to use is [EdgeAssetDeliveryServiceEnabled](#edgeassetdeliveryserviceenabled).

BeforeunloadEventCancelByPreventDefaultE.name: Control the behavior for the cancel dialog produced by the beforeunload event (obsolete)
BeforeunloadEventCancelByPreventDefaultE.summary: This policy provides a temporary opt-out for two related fixes to the behavior of the confirmation dialog that’s shown by the beforeunload event.

BingAdsSuppression.name: Block all ads on Bing search results
BingAdsSuppression.summary: Enables an ad-free search experience on Bing.com

BlockThirdPartyCookies.name: Block third party cookies
BlockThirdPartyCookies.summary: Block web page elements that aren't from the domain that's in the address bar from setting cookies.

BrowserAddProfileEnabled.name: Enable profile creation from the Identity flyout menu or the Settings page
BrowserAddProfileEnabled.summary: Allows users to create new profiles, using the **Add profile** option.

BrowserCodeIntegritySetting.name: Configure browser process code integrity guard setting
BrowserCodeIntegritySetting.summary: This policy controls the use of code integrity guard in the browser process, which only allows Microsoft signed binaries to load.

BrowserGuestModeEnabled.name: Enable guest mode
BrowserGuestModeEnabled.summary: Enable the option to allow the use of guest profiles in Microsoft Edge. In a guest profile, the browser doesn't import browsing data from existing profiles, and it deletes browsing data when all guest profiles are closed.

BrowserLegacyExtensionPointsBlockingEnab.name: Enable browser legacy extension point blocking
BrowserLegacyExtensionPointsBlockingEnab.summary: Sets the ProcessExtensionPointDisablePolicy on Microsoft Edge's browser process to block code injection from legacy third party applications.

BrowserNetworkTimeQueriesEnabled.name: Allow queries to a Browser Network Time service
BrowserNetworkTimeQueriesEnabled.summary: Prevents Microsoft Edge from occasionally sending queries to a browser network time service to retrieve an accurate timestamp.

BrowserSignin.name: Browser sign-in settings
BrowserSignin.summary: Specify whether a user can sign into Microsoft Edge with their account and use account-related services like sync and single sign on. To control the availability of sync, use the [SyncDisabled](#syncdisabled) policy instead.

BrowsingDataLifetime.name: Browsing Data Lifetime Settings
BrowsingDataLifetime.summary: Configures browsing data lifetime settings for Microsoft Edge.

BuiltInDnsClientEnabled.name: Use built-in DNS client
BuiltInDnsClientEnabled.summary: Controls whether to use the built-in DNS client.

BuiltinCertificateVerifierEnabled.name: Determines whether the built-in certificate verifier will be used to verify server certificates (obsolete)
BuiltinCertificateVerifierEnabled.summary: This policy is obsolete because it was a short-term mechanism to give enterprises more time to update their environments and report issues if they are found to be incompatible with the built-in certificate verifier.

CECPQ2Enabled.name: CECPQ2 post-quantum key-agreement enabled for TLS (obsolete)
CECPQ2Enabled.summary: This policy was removed in Microsoft Edge 114 and is ignored if set. It served to disable CECPQ2, but CECPQ2 has been disabled by default. A separate policy will be introduced to control the rollout of the replacement of CECPQ2. That replacement will be a combination of the standard key-agreement X25519 with NIST's chosen post-quantum KEM, called "Kyber".

CORSNonWildcardRequestHeadersSupport.name: CORS non-wildcard request header support enabled
CORSNonWildcardRequestHeadersSupport.summary: This policy lets you configure support of CORS non-wildcard request headers.

CSSCustomStateDeprecatedSyntaxEnabled.name: Controls whether the deprecated :--foo syntax for CSS custom state is enabled (deprecated)
CSSCustomStateDeprecatedSyntaxEnabled.summary: The :--foo syntax for the CSS custom state feature is being changed to :state(foo) in Microsoft Edge in order to comply with changes that have been made in Firefox and Safari. This policy lets the deprecated syntax to be used until Stable 133.

CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabl.name: Disable Certificate Transparency enforcement for a list of subjectPublicKeyInfo hashes
CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabl.summary: Disables enforcement of Certificate Transparency requirements for a list of subjectPublicKeyInfo hashes.

CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabl.name: Disable Certificate Transparency enforcement for a list of legacy certificate authorities (obsolete)
CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabl.summary: Disables enforcing Certificate Transparency requirements for a list of legacy certificate authorities (Cas).

CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabl.name: Disable Certificate Transparency enforcement for specific URLs
CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabl.summary: Disables enforcing Certificate Transparency requirements for the listed URLs.

ClearBrowsingDataOnExit.name: Clear browsing data when Microsoft Edge closes
ClearBrowsingDataOnExit.summary: Microsoft Edge doesn't clear the browsing data by default when it closes. Browsing data includes information entered in forms, passwords, and even the websites visited.

ClearCachedImagesAndFilesOnExit.name: Clear cached images and files when Microsoft Edge closes
ClearCachedImagesAndFilesOnExit.summary: Microsoft Edge doesn't clear cached images and files by default when it closes.

ClickOnceEnabled.name: Allow users to open files using the ClickOnce protocol
ClickOnceEnabled.summary: Allow users to open files using the ClickOnce protocol. The ClickOnce protocol allows websites to request that the browser open files from a specific URL using the ClickOnce file handler on the user's computer or device.

ClipboardAllowedForUrls.name: Allow clipboard use on specific sites
