ClipboardAllowedForUrls.summary: Configure the list of URL patterns that specify which sites can use the clipboard site permission.

ClipboardBlockedForUrls.name: Block clipboard use on specific sites
ClipboardBlockedForUrls.summary: Configure the list of URL patterns that specify which sites can use the clipboard site permission.

CollectionsServicesAndExportsBlockList.name: Block access to a specified list of services and export targets in Collections
CollectionsServicesAndExportsBlockList.summary: List specific services and export targets that users can't access in the Collections feature in Microsoft Edge. This includes displaying additional data from Bing and exporting collections to Microsoft products or external partners.

CommandLineFlagSecurityWarningsEnabled.name: Enable security warnings for command-line flags
CommandLineFlagSecurityWarningsEnabled.summary: If disabled, this policy prevents security warnings from appearing when Microsoft Edge is launched with potentially dangerous command-line flags.

ComponentUpdatesEnabled.name: Enable component updates in Microsoft Edge
ComponentUpdatesEnabled.summary: If you enable or don't configure this policy, component updates are enabled in Microsoft Edge.

ComposeInlineEnabled.name: Compose is enabled for writing on the web
ComposeInlineEnabled.summary: This policy lets you configure Compose in Microsoft Edge. Compose provides help for writing with AI-generated text, which lets the user get ideas for writing. This includes elaborating on text, re-writing, changing tone, formatting the text, and more.

ConfigureDoNotTrack.name: Configure Do Not Track
ConfigureDoNotTrack.summary: Specify whether to send Do Not Track requests to websites that ask for tracking info. Do Not Track requests let the websites you visit know that you don't want your browsing activity to be tracked. By default, Microsoft Edge doesn't send Do Not Track requests, but users can turn on this feature to send them.

ConfigureFriendlyURLFormat.name: Configure the default paste format of URLs copied from Microsoft Edge, and determine if additional formats will be available to users
ConfigureFriendlyURLFormat.summary: If FriendlyURLs are enabled, Microsoft Edge will compute additional representations of the URL and place them on the clipboard.

ConfigureKeyboardShortcuts.name: Configure the list of commands for which to disable keyboard shortcuts
ConfigureKeyboardShortcuts.summary: Configure the list of Microsoft Edge commands for which to disable keyboard shortcuts.

ConfigureOnPremisesAccountAutoSignIn.name: Configure automatic sign in with an Active Directory domain account when there is no Azure AD domain account
ConfigureOnPremisesAccountAutoSignIn.summary: Enable the use of Active Directory accounts for automatic sign in if your users' machines are Domain Joined and your environment is not hybrid joined. If you want users automatically signed in with their Azure Active Directory accounts instead, please Azure AD join (See [https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2118197](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2118197) for more information) or hybrid join (See [https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2118365](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2118365) for more information) your environment.

ConfigureOnlineTextToSpeech.name: Configure Online Text To Speech
ConfigureOnlineTextToSpeech.summary: Set whether the browser can leverage Online Text to Speech voice fonts, part of Azure Cognitive Services. These voice fonts are higher quality than the pre-installed system voice fonts.

ConfigureShare.name: Configure the Share experience
ConfigureShare.summary: If you set this policy to 'ShareAllowed' (the default), users will be able to access the Share experience from the Settings and More Menu in Microsoft Edge to share with other apps on the system.

ConfigureViewInFileExplorer.name: Configure the View in File Explorer feature for SharePoint pages in Microsoft Edge
ConfigureViewInFileExplorer.summary: This setting allows you to configure the View in File Explorer capability for file management in SharePoint Online while using Microsoft Edge.

CopilotCDPPageContext.name: Control Copilot with Commercial Data Protection access to page context for Microsoft Entra ID profiles (obsolete)
CopilotCDPPageContext.summary: This policy has been obsoleted as of Edge 133. Instead of this obsolete policy, we recommend using [EdgeEntraCopilotPageContext](#edgeentracopilotpagecontext).

CopilotPageContext.name: Control Copilot access to page context for Microsoft Entra ID profiles
CopilotPageContext.summary: This policy controls access to page contents for Copilot in the Microsoft Edge sidebar when users are logged into their MSA Copilot account. This policy applies only to Microsoft Entra ID Microsoft Edge profiles. To summarize pages and interact with text selections, it needs to be able to access the page contents. This policy does not apply to MSA Microsoft Edge profiles. This policy doesn't control access for Copilot with enterprise data protection (EDP). Access for Copilot with enterprise data protection (EDP) is controlled by the [EdgeEntraCopilotPageContext](#edgeentracopilotpagecontext) policy.

CreatePasskeysInICloudKeychain.name: Control whether passkey creation will default to iCloud Keychain.

CrossOriginWebAssemblyModuleSharingEnabl.name: Specifies whether WebAssembly modules can be sent cross-origin (obsolete)
CrossOriginWebAssemblyModuleSharingEnabl.summary: Specifies whether WebAssembly modules can be sent to another window or worker cross-origin. Cross-origin WebAssembly module sharing was deprecated as part of the efforts to deprecate document.domain, see https://github.com/mikewest/deprecating-document-domain. This policy allowed re-enabling of cross-origin WebAssembly module sharing. This policy is obsolete because it was intended to offer a longer transition period in the deprecation process.

CryptoWalletEnabled.name: Enable CryptoWallet feature (obsolete)
CryptoWalletEnabled.summary: This policy is obsoleted because this feature will no longer be supported, starting in Microsoft Edge 128. There is no replacement for this policy.

CustomHelpLink.name: Specify custom help link
CustomHelpLink.summary: Specify a link for the Help menu or the F1 key.

DNSInterceptionChecksEnabled.name: DNS interception checks enabled
DNSInterceptionChecksEnabled.summary: This policy configures a local switch that can be used to disable DNS interception checks. These checks attempt to discover whether the browser is behind a proxy that redirects unknown host names.

DefaultBrowserSettingEnabled.name: Set Microsoft Edge as default browser
DefaultBrowserSettingEnabled.summary: If you set this policy to True, Microsoft Edge always checks whether it's the default browser on startup and, if possible, automatically registers itself.

DefaultBrowserSettingsCampaignEnabled.name: Enables default browser settings campaigns
DefaultBrowserSettingsCampaignEnabled.summary: This policy enables the default browser settings campaign. If a user clicks to accept the campaign, their default browser and/or default search engine will be changed to Microsoft Edge and Microsoft Bing, respectively. If the user dismisses the campaign, the user's browser settings will remain unchanged.

DefaultClipboardSetting.name: Default clipboard site permission
DefaultClipboardSetting.summary: This policy controls the default value for the clipboard site permission.

DefaultSearchProviderContextMenuAccessAl.name: Allow default search provider context menu search access
DefaultSearchProviderContextMenuAccessAl.summary: Enables the use of a default search provider on the context menu.

DefaultSensorsSetting.name: Default sensors setting
DefaultSensorsSetting.summary: Set whether websites can access and use sensors such as motion and light sensors. You can completely block or allow websites to get access to sensors.

DefaultSerialGuardSetting.name: Control use of the Serial API
DefaultSerialGuardSetting.summary: Set whether websites can access serial ports. You can completely block access or ask the user each time a website wants to get access to a serial port.

DefaultShareAdditionalOSRegionSetting.name: Set the default "share additional operating system region" setting
DefaultShareAdditionalOSRegionSetting.summary: This policy controls the default value for the "share additional operating system region" setting in Microsoft Edge.

DefinePreferredLanguages.name: Define an ordered list of preferred languages that websites should display in if the site supports the language
DefinePreferredLanguages.summary: Configures the language variants that Microsoft Edge sends to websites as part of the Accept-Language request HTTP header and prevents users from adding, removing, or changing the order of preferred languages in Microsoft Edge settings. Users who want to change the languages Microsoft Edge displays in or offers to translate pages to will be limited to the languages configured in this policy.

DelayNavigationsForInitialSiteListDownlo.name: Require that the Enterprise Mode Site List is available before tab navigation
DelayNavigationsForInitialSiteListDownlo.summary: Lets you specify whether Microsoft Edge tabs wait to navigate until the browser has downloaded the initial Enterprise Mode Site List. This setting is intended for the scenario where the browser home page should load in Internet Explorer mode, and it is important that is does so on browser first run after IE mode is enabled. If this scenario does not exist, we recommend not enabling this setting because it can negatively impact the performance of loading the home page. The setting only applies when Microsoft Edge does not have a cached Enterprise Mode Site List, such as on browser first run after IE mode is enabled.

DeleteDataOnMigration.name: Delete old browser data on migration
DeleteDataOnMigration.summary: This policy determines whether user browsing data from Microsoft Edge Legacy will be deleted after migrating to the Microsoft Edge version 81 or later.

DeveloperToolsAvailability.name: Control where developer tools can be used
DeveloperToolsAvailability.summary: Control where developer tools can be used.

DiagnosticData.name: Send required and optional diagnostic data about browser usage
DiagnosticData.summary: This policy controls sending required and optional diagnostic data about browser usage to Microsoft.

DirectInvokeEnabled.name: Allow users to open files using the DirectInvoke protocol
DirectInvokeEnabled.summary: Allow users to open files using the DirectInvoke protocol. The DirectInvoke protocol allows websites to request that the browser open files from a specific URL using a specific file handler on the user's computer or device.

Disable3DAPIs.name: Disable support for 3D graphics APIs
Disable3DAPIs.summary: Prevent web pages from accessing the graphics processing unit (GPU). Specifically, web pages can't access the WebGL API and plug-ins can't use the Pepper 3D API.

DisableScreenshots.name: Disable taking screenshots
DisableScreenshots.summary: Controls if users can take screenshots of the browser page.

DiscoverPageContextEnabled.name: Enable Discover access to page contents for AAD profiles (obsolete)
DiscoverPageContextEnabled.summary: This policy has been obsoleted as of Edge 127. Two new Edge Policies have taken its place. Those policies are CopilotPageContext (Control Copilot access to page contents for AAD profiles), and CopilotCDPPageContext (Control Copilot with Commercial Data Protection access to page contents for AAD profiles).

DiskCacheDir.name: Set disk cache directory
DiskCacheDir.summary: Configures the directory to use to store cached files.

DiskCacheSize.name: Set disk cache size, in bytes
DiskCacheSize.summary: Configures the size of the cache, in bytes, used to store files on the disk.

DisplayCapturePermissionsPolicyEnabled.name: Specifies whether the display-capture permissions-policy is checked or skipped (obsolete)
DisplayCapturePermissionsPolicyEnabled.summary: This policy is obsolete. The policy was a temporary workaround for non-spec-compliant enterprise applications.

DnsOverHttpsMode.name: Control the mode of DNS-over-HTTPS
DnsOverHttpsMode.summary: Control the mode of the DNS-over-HTTPS resolver. Note that this policy will only set the default mode for each query. The mode can be overridden for special types of queries such as requests to resolve a DNS-over-HTTPS server hostname.

DnsOverHttpsTemplates.name: Specify URI template of desired DNS-over-HTTPS resolver
DnsOverHttpsTemplates.summary: The URI template of the desired DNS-over-HTTPS resolver. To specify multiple DNS-over-HTTPS resolvers, separate the corresponding URI templates with spaces.

DoNotSilentlyBlockProtocolsFromOrigins.name: Define a list of protocols that can not be silently blocked by anti-flood protection
DoNotSilentlyBlockProtocolsFromOrigins.summary: Allows you to create a list of protocols, and for each protocol an associated list of allowed origin patterns. These origins won't be silently blocked from launching an external application by anti-flood protection. The trailing separator shouldn't be included when listing the protocol. For example, list "skype" instead of "skype:" or "skype://".

DoubleClickCloseTabEnabled.name: Double Click feature in Microsoft Edge enabled (only available in China)
DoubleClickCloseTabEnabled.summary: This policy lets you configure the double click feature in Microsoft Edge.

DownloadDirectory.name: Set download directory
DownloadDirectory.summary: Configures the directory to use when downloading files.

DownloadRestrictions.name: Allow download restrictions
DownloadRestrictions.summary: Configures the type of downloads that Microsoft Edge completely blocks, without letting users override the security decision.

DynamicCodeSettings.name: Dynamic Code Settings
DynamicCodeSettings.summary: This policy controls the dynamic code settings for Microsoft Edge.

Edge3PSerpTelemetryEnabled.name: Edge 3P SERP Telemetry Enabled
Edge3PSerpTelemetryEnabled.summary: Edge3P Telemetry in Microsoft Edge captures the searches user does on third party search providers without identifying the person or the device and captures only if the user has consented to this collection of data. User can turn off the collection at any time in the browser settings.

EdgeAssetDeliveryServiceEnabled.name: Allow features to download assets from the Asset Delivery Service
EdgeAssetDeliveryServiceEnabled.summary: The Asset Delivery Service is a general pipeline used to deliver assets to the Microsoft Edge Clients.

EdgeCollectionsEnabled.name: Enable the Collections feature
EdgeCollectionsEnabled.summary: Lets you allow users to access the Collections feature, where they can collect, organize, share, and export content more efficiently and with Office integration.

EdgeDiscoverEnabled.name: Discover feature In Microsoft Edge (obsolete)
EdgeDiscoverEnabled.summary: This policy doesn't work because Discover is now contained within the Edge Sidebar and can be managed using the [HubsSidebarEnabled](#hubssidebarenabled) policy.

EdgeEDropEnabled.name: Enable Drop feature in Microsoft Edge
EdgeEDropEnabled.summary: This policy lets you configure the Drop feature in Microsoft Edge.

EdgeEnhanceImagesEnabled.name: Enhance images enabled (obsolete)
EdgeEnhanceImagesEnabled.summary: The enhance images feature is deprecated and starting in 122 this policy will be removed. Set whether Microsoft Edge can automatically enhance images to show you sharper images with better color, lighting, and contrast.

EdgeEntraCopilotPageContext.name: Control access to page content for Entra ID Profiles accessing Microsoft Copilot with Enterprise Data Protection (EDP) from the Microsoft Edge sidebar
EdgeEntraCopilotPageContext.summary: This policy controls access to page contents for Microsoft Copilot with enterprise data protection (EDP) in the Microsoft Edge sidebar for the web tab only. This policy controls whether Microsoft Copilot can perform page summarization and similar contextual queries.

EdgeFollowEnabled.name: Enable Follow service in Microsoft Edge (obsolete)
EdgeFollowEnabled.summary: Lets Microsoft Edge browser enable Follow service and apply it to users.

EdgeOpenInSidebarEnabled.name: Enable open in sidebar
EdgeOpenInSidebarEnabled.summary: Allow/Disallow user open a website or an app to the sidebar.

EdgeShoppingAssistantEnabled.name: Shopping in Microsoft Edge Enabled
EdgeShoppingAssistantEnabled.summary: This policy lets users compare the prices of a product they are looking at, get coupons or rebates from the website they're on, auto-apply coupons and help checkout faster using autofill data.

EdgeSidebarAppUrlHostAllowList.name: Allow specific apps to be opened in Microsoft Edge sidebar
EdgeSidebarAppUrlHostAllowList.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that are not subject to the [EdgeSidebarAppUrlHostBlockList](#edgesidebarappurlhostblocklist).

EdgeSidebarAppUrlHostBlockList.name: Control which apps cannot be opened in Microsoft Edge sidebar
EdgeSidebarAppUrlHostBlockList.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that cannot be opened in sidebar.

EdgeSidebarAppUrlHostForceList.name: Control which apps are forced to be shown in Microsoft Edge sidebar
EdgeSidebarAppUrlHostForceList.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL, that are forced to be shown in sidebar.

EdgeWalletCheckoutEnabled.name: Enable Wallet Checkout feature
EdgeWalletCheckoutEnabled.summary: Enables Wallet Checkout feature in Microsoft Edge.

EdgeWalletEtreeEnabled.name: Edge Wallet E-Tree Enabled
EdgeWalletEtreeEnabled.summary: The Edge Wallet E-Tree feature in Microsoft Edge allows users to plant a E-Tree for their own.

EditFavoritesEnabled.name: Allows users to edit favorites
EditFavoritesEnabled.summary: Enable this policy to let users add, remove, and modify favorites. This is the default behavior if you don't configure the policy.

EnableDeprecatedWebPlatformFeatures.name: Re-enable deprecated web platform features for a limited time (obsolete)
EnableDeprecatedWebPlatformFeatures.summary: This policy is obsolete because dedicated web platform policies are now used to manage individual web platform feature deprecations.

EnableDomainActionsDownload.name: Enable Domain Actions Download from Microsoft (obsolete)
EnableDomainActionsDownload.summary: This policy doesn't work because conflicting states should be avoided. This policy was used to enable/disable download of the domain actions list, but it didn't always achieve the desired state. The Experimentation and Configuration Service, which handles the download, has its own policy to configure what is downloaded from the service. Use the [ExperimentationAndConfigurationServiceControl](#experimentationandconfigurationservicecontrol) policy instead.

EnableOnlineRevocationChecks.name: Enable online OCSP/CRL checks
EnableOnlineRevocationChecks.summary: Online revocation checks don't provide a significant security benefit and are disabled by default.

EnableSha1ForLocalAnchors.name: Allow certificates signed using SHA-1 when issued by local trust anchors (obsolete)
EnableSha1ForLocalAnchors.summary: When this setting is enabled, Microsoft Edge allows connections secured by SHA-1 signed certificates so long as the the certificate chains to a locally-installed root certificate and is otherwise valid.

EncryptedClientHelloEnabled.name: TLS Encrypted ClientHello Enabled
EncryptedClientHelloEnabled.summary: Encrypted ClientHello (ECH) is an extension to TLS that encrypts the sensitive fields of ClientHello to improve privacy.

EnforceLocalAnchorConstraintsEnabled.name: Determines whether the built-in certificate verifier will enforce constraints encoded into trust anchors loaded from the platform trust store (obsolete)
EnforceLocalAnchorConstraintsEnabled.summary: X.509 certificates may encode constraints, such as Name Constraints, in extensions in the certificate. RFC 5280 specifies that enforcing such constraints on trust anchor certificates is optional.

EnhanceSecurityMode.name: Enhance the security state in Microsoft Edge
EnhanceSecurityMode.summary: This policy lets you enhance the security state in Microsoft Edge.

EnhanceSecurityModeAllowUserBypass.name: Allow users to bypass Enhanced Security Mode
EnhanceSecurityModeAllowUserBypass.summary: Microsoft Edge will let users bypass Enhanced Security Mode on a site via Settings page or PageInfo flyout. This policy lets you configure whether users can bypass Enhanced Security Mode.

EnhanceSecurityModeBypassIntranet.name: Enhanced Security Mode configuration for Intranet zone sites
EnhanceSecurityModeBypassIntranet.summary: Microsoft Edge will apply Enhanced Security Mode on Intranet zone sites by default. This may lead to Intranet zone sites acting in an unexpected manner.

EnhanceSecurityModeBypassListDomains.name: Configure the list of domains for which enhance security mode will not be enforced
EnhanceSecurityModeBypassListDomains.summary: Configure the list of enhance security trusted domains. This means that

EnhanceSecurityModeEnforceListDomains.name: Configure the list of domains for which enhance security mode will always be enforced
EnhanceSecurityModeEnforceListDomains.summary: Configure the list of enhance security untrusted domains. This means that

EnhanceSecurityModeIndicatorUIEnabled.name: Manage the indicator UI of the Enhanced Security Mode (ESM) feature in Microsoft Edge
EnhanceSecurityModeIndicatorUIEnabled.summary: This policy lets you manage whether the indicator User Interface (UI) for enhanced security mode is shown or not when ESM is turned on.

EnhanceSecurityModeOptOutUXEnabled.name: Manage opt-out user experience for Enhanced Security Mode (ESM) in Microsoft Edge (deprecated)
EnhanceSecurityModeOptOutUXEnabled.summary: This policy lets you manage whether the opt-out user experience for enhanced security mode is presented when ESM is turned on for Microsoft Edge.

EnterpriseHardwarePlatformAPIEnabled.name: Allow managed extensions to use the Enterprise Hardware Platform API
EnterpriseHardwarePlatformAPIEnabled.summary: When this policy is set to enabled, extensions installed by enterprise policy are allowed to use the Enterprise Hardware Platform API.

EnterpriseModeSiteListManagerAllowed.name: Allow access to the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager tool
EnterpriseModeSiteListManagerAllowed.summary: Allows you to set whether Enterprise Mode Site List Manager is available to users.

EventPathEnabled.name: Re-enable the Event.path API until Microsoft Edge version 115 (obsolete)
EventPathEnabled.summary: Starting in Microsoft Edge version 109, the non-standard API Event.path will be removed to improve web compatibility. This policy re-enables the API until version 115.

ExemptDomainFileTypePairsFromFileTypeDow.name: Disable download file type extension-based warnings for specified file types on domains (obsolete)
ExemptDomainFileTypePairsFromFileTypeDow.summary: This policy has been obsoleted in favor of [ExemptFileTypeDownloadWarnings](#exemptfiletypedownloadwarnings) because of a type mismatch that caused errors in Mac.

ExemptFileTypeDownloadWarnings.name: Disable download file type extension-based warnings for specified file types on domains
ExemptFileTypeDownloadWarnings.summary: You can enable this policy to create a dictionary of file type extensions with a corresponding list of domains that will be exempted from file type extension-based download warnings. This lets enterprise administrators block file type extension-based download warnings for files that are associated with a listed domain. For example, if  the "jnlp" extension is associated with "website1.com", users would not see a warning when downloading "jnlp" files from "website1.com", but see a download warning when downloading "jnlp" files from "website2.com".

ExperimentationAndConfigurationServiceCo.name: Control communication with the Experimentation and Configuration Service
ExperimentationAndConfigurationServiceCo.summary: The Experimentation and Configuration Service is used to deploy Experimentation and Configuration payloads to the client.

ExplicitlyAllowedNetworkPorts.name: Explicitly allowed network ports
ExplicitlyAllowedNetworkPorts.summary: There is a list of restricted ports built into Microsoft Edge. Connections to these ports will fail. This policy allows bypassing that list. The set of ports is defined as a comma-separated list that outgoing connections should be permitted on.

ExternalProtocolDialogShowAlwaysOpenChec.name: Show an "Always open" checkbox in external protocol dialog
ExternalProtocolDialogShowAlwaysOpenChec.summary: This policy controls whether the "Always allow this site to open links of this type" checkbox is shown on external protocol launch confirmation prompts. This policy only applies to https:// links.

FamilySafetySettingsEnabled.name: Allow users to configure Family safety and Kids Mode
FamilySafetySettingsEnabled.summary: This policy disables two family safety related features in the browser. This will hide the Family page inside Settings and navigation to edge://settings/family will be blocked. The family settings page describes what features are available with family groups with Microsoft Family Safety. Learn more about Family Safety here: ([https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2098432](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2098432)). Starting in Microsoft Edge 90, this policy also disables Kids Mode, a kid friendly browsing mode with custom themes and allow list browsing that requires the device password to exit. Learn more about Kids Mode here: ([https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2146910](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2146910))

FavoritesBarEnabled.name: Enable favorites bar
FavoritesBarEnabled.summary: Enables or disables the favorites bar.

FetchKeepaliveDurationSecondsOnShutdown.name: Fetch keepalive duration on shutdown
FetchKeepaliveDurationSecondsOnShutdown.summary: Controls the duration (in seconds) that keepalive requests are allowed to prevent the browser from completing its shutdown.

FileOrDirectoryPickerWithoutGestureAllow.name: Allow file or directory picker APIs to be called without prior user gesture
FileOrDirectoryPickerWithoutGestureAllow.summary: For security reasons, the showOpenFilePicker(), showSaveFilePicker() and showDirectoryPicker() web APIs require a prior user gesture ("transient activation") to be called or will otherwise fail.

ForceBingSafeSearch.name: Enforce Bing SafeSearch
ForceBingSafeSearch.summary: Ensure that queries in Bing web search are done with SafeSearch set to the value specified. Users can't change this setting.

ForceBuiltInPushMessagingClient.name: Forces Microsoft Edge to use its built-in WNS push client to connect to the Windows Push Notification Service.
ForceBuiltInPushMessagingClient.summary: In some environments, the Windows OS client can't connect to the Windows Push Notification Service (WNS). For these environments, you can use the Microsoft Edge built-in WNS push client, which may be able to connect successfully.

ForceCertificatePromptsOnMultipleMatches.name: Configure whether Microsoft Edge should automatically select a certificate when there are multiple certificate matches for a site configured with "AutoSelectCertificateForUrls" (deprecated)
ForceCertificatePromptsOnMultipleMatches.summary: This policy is deprecated because we are moving to a new policy. It won't work in Microsoft Edge version 104. The new policy to use is [PromptOnMultipleMatchingCertificates](#promptonmultiplematchingcertificates).

ForceEphemeralProfiles.name: Enable use of ephemeral profiles
ForceEphemeralProfiles.summary: Controls whether user profiles are switched to ephemeral mode. An ephemeral profile is created when a session begins, is deleted when the session ends, and is associated with the user's original profile.

ForceGoogleSafeSearch.name: Enforce Google SafeSearch
ForceGoogleSafeSearch.summary: Forces queries in Google Web Search to be performed with SafeSearch set to active, and prevents users from changing this setting.

ForceLegacyDefaultReferrerPolicy.name: Use a default referrer policy of no-referrer-when-downgrade (obsolete)
ForceLegacyDefaultReferrerPolicy.summary: This policy doesn't work because it was only intended to be a short-term mechanism to give enterprises more time to update their web content if it was found to be incompatible with the new default referrer policy.

ForceMajorVersionToMinorPositionInUserAg.name: Enable or disable freezing the User-Agent string at major version 99 (obsolete)
ForceMajorVersionToMinorPositionInUserAg.summary: This policy was removed in Microsoft Edge 118 and is ignored if configured.

ForceNetworkInProcess.name: Force networking code to run in the browser process (obsolete)
ForceNetworkInProcess.summary: This policy doesn't work because it was only intended to be a short-term mechanism to give enterprises more time to migrate to 3rd party software that doesn't depend on hooking networking APIs. Proxy servers are recommended over LSPs and Win32 API patching.

ForcePermissionPolicyUnloadDefaultEnable.name: Controls whether unload event handlers can be disabled.
ForcePermissionPolicyUnloadDefaultEnable.summary: unload event handlers are being deprecated. Whether they fire depends on the unload Permissions-Policy.

ForceSync.name: Force synchronization of browser data and do not show the sync consent prompt
ForceSync.summary: Forces data synchronization in Microsoft Edge. This policy also prevents the user from turning sync off.

ForceSyncTypes.name: Configure the list of types that are included for synchronization
ForceSyncTypes.summary: If you enable this policy all the specified data types will be included for synchronization for Azure AD/Azure AD-Degraded user profiles. This policy can be used to ensure the type of data uploaded to the Microsoft Edge synchronization service.

ForceYouTubeRestrict.name: Force minimum YouTube Restricted Mode
ForceYouTubeRestrict.summary: Enforces a minimum Restricted Mode on YouTube and prevents users from picking a less restricted mode.

FullscreenAllowed.name: Allow full screen mode
FullscreenAllowed.summary: Set the availability of full screen mode - all Microsoft Edge UI is hidden and only web content is visible.

GloballyScopeHTTPAuthCacheEnabled.name: Enable globally scoped HTTP auth cache
GloballyScopeHTTPAuthCacheEnabled.summary: This policy configures a single global per profile cache with HTTP server authentication credentials.

GoToIntranetSiteForSingleWordEntryInAddr.name: Force direct intranet site navigation instead of searching on single word entries in the Address Bar
GoToIntranetSiteForSingleWordEntryInAddr.summary: If you enable this policy, the top auto-suggest result in the address bar suggestion list will navigate to intranet sites if the text entered in the address bar is a single word without punctuation.

HSTSPolicyBypassList.name: Configure the list of names that will bypass the HSTS policy check
HSTSPolicyBypassList.summary: Setting the policy specifies a list of hostnames that bypass preloaded HSTS upgrades from http to https.

HardwareAccelerationModeEnabled.name: Use graphics acceleration when available
HardwareAccelerationModeEnabled.summary: If you enable this policy, or leave it unconfigured, graphics acceleration will be utilized if it’s available.

HeadlessModeEnabled.name: Control use of the Headless Mode
HeadlessModeEnabled.summary: This policy setting lets you decide whether users can launch Microsoft Edge in headless mode.

HideFirstRunExperience.name: Hide the First-run experience and splash screen
HideFirstRunExperience.summary: If you enable this policy, the First-run experience and the splash screen will not be shown to users when they run Microsoft Edge for the first time.

HideInternetExplorerRedirectUXForIncompa.name: Hide the one-time redirection dialog and the banner on Microsoft Edge
HideInternetExplorerRedirectUXForIncompa.summary: This policy gives an option to disable one-time redirection dialog and the banner. When this policy is enabled, users will not see both the one-time dialog and the banner.

HideRestoreDialogEnabled.name: Hide restore pages dialog after browser crash
HideRestoreDialogEnabled.summary: This policy gives an option to hide the "Restore pages" dialog after Microsoft Edge has crashed. The "Restore pages" dialog gives users the option to restore the pages that were previously open before Microsoft Edge crashed.

HttpAllowlist.name: HTTP Allowlist
HttpAllowlist.summary: Setting the policy specifies a list of hostnames or hostname patterns (such as '[\*.]example.com') that will not be upgraded to HTTPS and will not show an error interstitial if HTTPS-First Mode is enabled. Organizations can use this policy to maintain access to servers that do not support HTTPS, without needing to disable [AutomaticHttpsDefault](#automatichttpsdefault).

HubsSidebarEnabled.name: Show Hubs Sidebar
HubsSidebarEnabled.summary: Sidebar is a launcher bar on the right side of Microsoft Edge's screen.

ImportAutofillFormData.name: Allow importing of autofill form data
ImportAutofillFormData.summary: Allows users to import autofill form data from another browser into Microsoft Edge.

ImportBrowserSettings.name: Allow importing of browser settings
ImportBrowserSettings.summary: Allows users to import browser settings from another browser into Microsoft Edge.

ImportCookies.name: Allow importing of Cookies
ImportCookies.summary: Allows users to import Cookies from another browser into Microsoft Edge.

ImportExtensions.name: Allow importing of extensions
ImportExtensions.summary: Allows users to import extensions from another browser into Microsoft Edge.

ImportFavorites.name: Allow importing of favorites
ImportFavorites.summary: Allows users to import favorites from another browser into Microsoft Edge.

ImportHistory.name: Allow importing of browsing history
ImportHistory.summary: Allows users to import their browsing history from another browser into Microsoft Edge.

ImportHomepage.name: Allow importing of home page settings
ImportHomepage.summary: Allows users to import their home page setting from another browser into Microsoft Edge.

ImportOnEachLaunch.name: Allow import of data from other browsers on each Microsoft Edge launch
ImportOnEachLaunch.summary: If you enable this policy, users will see a prompt to import their browsing data from other browsers on each Microsoft Edge launch.

ImportOpenTabs.name: Allow importing of open tabs
ImportOpenTabs.summary: Allows users to import open and pinned tabs from another browser into Microsoft Edge.

ImportPaymentInfo.name: Allow importing of payment info
ImportPaymentInfo.summary: Allows users to import payment info from another browser into Microsoft Edge.

ImportSavedPasswords.name: Allow importing of saved passwords
ImportSavedPasswords.summary: Allows users to import saved passwords from another browser into Microsoft Edge.

ImportSearchEngine.name: Allow importing of search engine settings
ImportSearchEngine.summary: Allows users to import search engine settings from another browser into Microsoft Edge.

ImportShortcuts.name: Allow importing of shortcuts
ImportShortcuts.summary: Allows users to import Shortcuts from another browser into Microsoft Edge.

ImportStartupPageSettings.name: Allow importing of startup page settings
ImportStartupPageSettings.summary: Allows users to import Startup settings from another browser into Microsoft Edge.

InAppSupportEnabled.name: In-app support Enabled
InAppSupportEnabled.summary: Microsoft Edge uses the in-app support feature (enabled by default) to allow users to contact our support agents directly from the browser. Also, by default, users can't disable (turn off) the in-app support feature.

InPrivateModeAvailability.name: Configure InPrivate mode availability
InPrivateModeAvailability.summary: Specifies whether the user can open pages in InPrivate mode in Microsoft Edge.

InsecureFormsWarningsEnabled.name: Enable warnings for insecure forms (deprecated)
InsecureFormsWarningsEnabled.summary: This policy controls the handling of insecure forms (forms submitted over HTTP) embedded in secure (HTTPS) sites in the browser.

IntensiveWakeUpThrottlingEnabled.name: Control the IntensiveWakeUpThrottling feature
IntensiveWakeUpThrottlingEnabled.summary: When enabled the IntensiveWakeUpThrottling feature causes Javascript timers in background tabs to be aggressively throttled and coalesced, running no more than once per minute after a page has been backgrounded for 5 minutes or more.

InternetExplorerIntegrationAlwaysUseOSCa.name: Always use the OS capture engine to avoid issues with capturing Internet Explorer mode tabs
InternetExplorerIntegrationAlwaysUseOSCa.summary: Configure this policy to control whether Microsoft Edge will use the "OS capture engine" or the "Browser capture engine" when capturing browser windows in the same process using the screen-share APIs.

InternetExplorerIntegrationAlwaysWaitFor.name: Wait for Internet Explorer mode tabs to completely unload before ending the browser session
InternetExplorerIntegrationAlwaysWaitFor.summary: This policy causes Microsoft Edge to continue running until all Internet Explorer tabs have completely finished unloading. This allows Internet Explorer plugins like ActiveX controls to perform additional critical work even after the browser has been closed. However, this can cause stability and performance issues, and Microsoft Edge processes may remain active in the background with no visible windows if the webpage or plugin prevents Internet Explorer from unloading. This policy should only be used if your organization depends on a plugin that requires this behavior.

InternetExplorerIntegrationCloudNeutralS.name: Configure reporting of potentially misconfigured neutral site URLs to the M365 Admin Center Site Lists app
InternetExplorerIntegrationCloudNeutralS.summary: This setting lets you enable reporting of sites that might need to be configured as a neutral site on the Enterprise Mode Site List. The user must be signed into Microsoft Edge with a valid work or school account for reports to be sent, and the user's account tenant must match the tenant specified by the policy.

InternetExplorerIntegrationCloudSiteList.name: Configure the Enterprise Mode Cloud Site List
InternetExplorerIntegrationCloudSiteList.summary: The Microsoft Edge Site Lists setting in the M365 Admin Center allows you to host your site list(s) in a compliant cloud location and manage the contents of your site list(s) through the built-in experience. This setting allows you to specify which site list within the M365 Admin Center to deploy to your users. The user must be signed into Microsoft Edge with a valid work or school account. Otherwise, Microsoft Edge will not download the site list from the cloud location.

InternetExplorerIntegrationCloudUserSite.name: Configure reporting of IE Mode user list entries to the M365 Admin Center Site Lists app
InternetExplorerIntegrationCloudUserSite.summary: This setting lets you enable reporting of sites that Microsoft Edge users add to their local IE Mode site list. The user must be signed into Microsoft Edge with a valid work or school account for reports to be sent, and the user's account tenant must match the tenant specified by the policy.

InternetExplorerIntegrationComplexNavDat.name: Configure whether form data and HTTP headers will be sent when entering or exiting Internet Explorer mode
InternetExplorerIntegrationComplexNavDat.summary: Starting with Microsoft Edge version 96, navigations that switch between Internet Explorer mode and Microsoft Edge will include form data.

InternetExplorerIntegrationEnhancedHangD.name: Configure enhanced hang detection for Internet Explorer mode
InternetExplorerIntegrationEnhancedHangD.summary: Enhanced hang detection is a more granular approach to detecting hung webpages in Internet Explorer mode than what standalone Internet Explorer uses. When a hung webpage is detected, the browser will apply a mitigation to prevent the rest of the browser from hanging.

InternetExplorerIntegrationLevel.name: Configure Internet Explorer integration
InternetExplorerIntegrationLevel.summary: For guidance about configuring the optimal experience for Internet Explorer mode see [https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2094210](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2094210)

InternetExplorerIntegrationLocalFileAllo.name: Allow launching of local files in Internet Explorer mode
InternetExplorerIntegrationLocalFileAllo.summary: This policy controls the availability of the --ie-mode-file-url command line argument which is used to launch Microsoft Edge with a local file specified on the command line into Internet Explorer mode.

InternetExplorerIntegrationLocalFileExte.name: Open local files in Internet Explorer mode file extension allow list
InternetExplorerIntegrationLocalFileExte.summary: This policy limits which file:// URLs are allowed to be launched into Internet Explorer mode based on file extension.

InternetExplorerIntegrationLocalFileShow.name: Show context menu to open a file:// link in Internet Explorer mode
InternetExplorerIntegrationLocalFileShow.summary: This policy controls the visibility of the 'Open link in new Internet Explorer mode tab' option on the context menu for file:// links.

InternetExplorerIntegrationLocalMhtFileA.name: Allow local MHTML files to open automatically in Internet Explorer mode
InternetExplorerIntegrationLocalMhtFileA.summary: This policy controls whether local mht or mhtml files launched from the command line can open automatically in Internet Explorer mode based on the file content without specifying the --ie-mode-file-url command line.

InternetExplorerIntegrationLocalSiteList.name: Specify the number of days that a site remains on the local IE mode site list
InternetExplorerIntegrationLocalSiteList.summary: If the [InternetExplorerIntegrationReloadInIEModeAllowed](#internetexplorerintegrationreloadiniemodeallowed) policy is enabled or not configured, users will be able to tell Microsoft Edge to load specific pages in Internet Explorer mode for a limited number of days.

InternetExplorerIntegrationReloadInIEMod.name: Allow unconfigured sites to be reloaded in Internet Explorer mode
InternetExplorerIntegrationReloadInIEMod.summary: This policy allows users to reload unconfigured sites (that are not configured in the Enterprise Mode Site List) in Internet Explorer mode when browsing in Microsoft Edge and a site requires Internet Explorer for compatibility.

InternetExplorerIntegrationSiteList.name: Configure the Enterprise Mode Site List
InternetExplorerIntegrationSiteList.summary: For guidance about configuring the optimal experience for Internet Explorer mode see [https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2094210](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2094210)

InternetExplorerIntegrationSiteListRefre.name: Configure how frequently the Enterprise Mode Site List is refreshed
InternetExplorerIntegrationSiteListRefre.summary: This setting lets you specify a custom refresh interval for the Enterprise Mode Site List. The refresh interval is specified in minutes. The minimum refresh interval is 30 minutes.

InternetExplorerIntegrationSiteRedirect.name: Specify how "in-page" navigations to unconfigured sites behave when started from Internet Explorer mode pages
InternetExplorerIntegrationSiteRedirect.summary: An "in-page" navigation is started from a link, a script, or a form on the current page. It can also be a server-side redirect of a previous "in-page" navigation attempt. Conversely, a user can start a navigation that isn't "in-page" that's independent of the current page in several ways by using the browser controls. For example, using the address bar, the back button, or a favorite link.

InternetExplorerIntegrationTestingAllowe.name: Allow Internet Explorer mode testing (obsolete)
InternetExplorerIntegrationTestingAllowe.summary: This policy is obsolete because it has been superseded by an improved feature. It doesn't work in Microsoft Edge after version 94. To allow users to open applications in Internet Explorer mode, use the [InternetExplorerIntegrationReloadInIEModeAllowed](#internetexplorerintegrationreloadiniemodeallowed) policy instead. Alternatively, users can still use the --ie-mode-test flag.

InternetExplorerIntegrationWindowOpenHei.name: Configure the pixel adjustment between window.open heights sourced from IE mode pages vs. Edge mode pages
InternetExplorerIntegrationWindowOpenHei.summary: This setting lets you specify a custom adjustment to the height of popup windows generated via window.open from the Internet Explorer mode site.

InternetExplorerIntegrationWindowOpenWid.name: Configure the pixel adjustment between window.open widths sourced from IE mode pages vs. Edge mode pages
InternetExplorerIntegrationWindowOpenWid.summary: This setting lets you specify a custom adjustment to the width of popup windows generated via window.open from the Internet Explorer mode site.

InternetExplorerIntegrationZoneIdentifie.name: Automatically open downloaded MHT or MHTML files from the web in Internet Explorer mode
InternetExplorerIntegrationZoneIdentifie.summary: This policy controls whether MHT or MHTML files that are downloaded from the web are automatically opened in Internet Explorer mode.

InternetExplorerModeClearDataOnExitEnabl.name: Clear history for IE and IE mode every time you exit
InternetExplorerModeClearDataOnExitEnabl.summary: This policy controls whether browsing history is deleted from Internet Explorer and Internet Explorer mode every time Microsoft Edge is closed.

InternetExplorerModeEnableSavePageAs.name: Allow Save page as in Internet Explorer mode
InternetExplorerModeEnableSavePageAs.summary: This policy enables 'Save page as' functionality in Internet Explorer mode.

InternetExplorerModeTabInEdgeModeAllowed.name: Allow sites configured for Internet Explorer mode to open in Microsoft Edge
InternetExplorerModeTabInEdgeModeAllowed.summary: This policy lets sites configured to open in Internet Explorer mode to be opened by Microsoft Edge for testing on a modern browser without removing them from the site list.

InternetExplorerModeToolbarButtonEnabled.name: Show the Reload in Internet Explorer mode button in the toolbar
InternetExplorerModeToolbarButtonEnabled.summary: Set this policy to show the Reload in Internet Explorer mode button in the toolbar. Users can hide the button in the toolbar through edge://settings/appearance.  The button will only be shown on the toolbar when the [InternetExplorerIntegrationReloadInIEModeAllowed](#internetexplorerintegrationreloadiniemodeallowed) policy is enabled or if the user has chosen to enable "Allow sites to be reloaded in Internet Explorer mode".

InternetExplorerSetForegroundWhenActive.name: Keep the active Microsoft Edge window with an Internet Explorer mode tab always in the foreground.
InternetExplorerSetForegroundWhenActive.summary: This policy controls whether to always keep the active Microsoft Edge window with an Internet Explorer mode tab in the foreground.

InternetExplorerZoomDisplay.name: Display zoom in IE Mode tabs with DPI Scale included like it is in Internet Explorer
InternetExplorerZoomDisplay.summary: Lets you display zoom in IE Mode tabs similar to how it was displayed in Internet Explorer, where the DPI scale of the display is factored in.

IntranetRedirectBehavior.name: Intranet Redirection Behavior
IntranetRedirectBehavior.summary: This policy configures behavior for intranet redirection via DNS interception checks. The checks attempt to discover whether the browser is behind a proxy that redirects unknown host names.

IsolateOrigins.name: Enable site isolation for specific origins
IsolateOrigins.summary: Specify origins to run in an isolated process.

KeyboardFocusableScrollersEnabled.name: Enable keyboard focusable scrollers
KeyboardFocusableScrollersEnabled.summary: This policy provides a temporary opt-out for the new keyboard focusable scrollers behavior.

LiveCaptionsAllowed.name: Live captions allowed
LiveCaptionsAllowed.summary: Allow users to turn the Live captions feature on or off.

LiveTranslationAllowed.name: Live translation allowed
LiveTranslationAllowed.summary: Lets users turn the Video translate feature on or off.

LocalBrowserDataShareEnabled.name: Enable Windows to search local Microsoft Edge browsing data
LocalBrowserDataShareEnabled.summary: Enables Windows to index Microsoft Edge browsing data stored locally on the user's device and allows users to find and launch previously stored browsing data directly from Windows features such as the search box on the taskbar in Windows.

LocalProvidersEnabled.name: Allow suggestions from local providers
LocalProvidersEnabled.summary: Allow suggestions from suggestion providers on the device (local providers), for example, Favorites and Browsing History, in Microsoft Edge's Address Bar and Auto-Suggest List.

MAUEnabled.name: Always use Microsoft AutoUpdate as the updater for Microsoft Edge
MAUEnabled.summary: This policy lets you configure the updater that Microsoft Edge uses.

MSAWebSiteSSOUsingThisProfileAllowed.name: Allow single sign-on for Microsoft personal sites using this profile
MSAWebSiteSSOUsingThisProfileAllowed.summary: 'Allow single sign-on for Microsoft personal sites using this profile' option allows non-MSA profiles to be able to use single sign-on for Microsoft sites using MSA credentials present on the machine. This option shows up for end-users as a toggle in Settings -> Profiles -> Profile Preferences for non-MSA profiles only.

ManagedConfigurationPerOrigin.name: Sets managed configuration values for websites to specific origins
ManagedConfigurationPerOrigin.summary: Setting this policy defines the return value of Managed Configuration API for given origin.

ManagedFavorites.name: Configure favorites
ManagedFavorites.summary: Configures a list of managed favorites.
ManagedFavorites.macos_preference_example_value:
