ManagedSearchEngines.name: Manage Search Engines
ManagedSearchEngines.summary: Lets you configure a list of up to 10 search engines, one of which must be marked as the default search engine. Starting in Microsoft Edge version 100, you can configure up to 100 engines.

MathSolverEnabled.name: Let users snip a Math problem and get the solution with a step-by-step explanation in Microsoft Edge (obsolete)
MathSolverEnabled.summary: This policy is obsoleted because Math Solver is deprecated from Edge. This policy won't work in Microsoft Edge version 126. This policy lets you manage whether users can use the Math Solver tool in Microsoft Edge or not.

MaxConnectionsPerProxy.name: Maximum number of concurrent connections to the proxy server
MaxConnectionsPerProxy.summary: Specifies the maximum number of simultaneous connections to the proxy server.

MediaRouterCastAllowAllIPs.name: Allow Google Cast to connect to Cast devices on all IP addresses
MediaRouterCastAllowAllIPs.summary: Enable this policy to let Google Cast connect to Cast devices on all IP addresses, not just RFC1918/RFC4193 private addresses.

MetricsReportingEnabled.name: Enable usage and crash-related data reporting (obsolete)
MetricsReportingEnabled.summary: This policy is no longer supported. It is replaced by [DiagnosticData](#diagnosticdata) (for Windows 7, Windows 8, and macOS) and Allow Telemetry on Win 10 ([https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2099569](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2099569)).

MicrosoftEdgeInsiderPromotionEnabled.name: Microsoft Edge Insider Promotion Enabled
MicrosoftEdgeInsiderPromotionEnabled.summary: Shows content promoting the Microsoft Edge Insider channels on the About Microsoft Edge settings page.

MicrosoftEditorProofingEnabled.name: Spell checking provided by Microsoft Editor
MicrosoftEditorProofingEnabled.summary: The Microsoft Editor service provides enhanced spell and grammar checking for editable text fields on web pages.

MicrosoftEditorSynonymsEnabled.name: Synonyms are provided when using Microsoft Editor spell checker
MicrosoftEditorSynonymsEnabled.summary: The Microsoft Editor service provides enhanced spell and grammar checking for editable text fields on web pages, and synonyms can be suggested as an integrated feature.

MicrosoftOfficeMenuEnabled.name: Allow users to access the Microsoft Office menu (deprecated)
MicrosoftOfficeMenuEnabled.summary: This policy is deprecated because it's been replaced by the Microsoft Edge sidebar. Microsoft Office applications are now available in the sidebar, which can be managed by HubsSidebarEnabled policy.

MicrosoftRootStoreEnabled.name: Determines whether the Microsoft Root Store and built-in certificate verifier will be used to verify server certificates (obsolete)
MicrosoftRootStoreEnabled.summary: When this policy is set to enabled, Microsoft Edge will perform verification of server certificates using the built-in certificate verifier with the Microsoft Root Store as the source of public trust.

MouseGestureEnabled.name: Mouse Gesture Enabled
MouseGestureEnabled.summary: This policy lets you configure the Mouse Gesture feature in Microsoft Edge.

MutationEventsEnabled.name: Enable deprecated/removed Mutation Events (deprecated)
MutationEventsEnabled.summary: This policy provides a temporary opt-in back to a deprecated and removed set of platform events named Mutation Events.

NativeHostsExecutablesLaunchDirectly.name: Force Windows executable Native Messaging hosts to launch directly
NativeHostsExecutablesLaunchDirectly.summary: This policy controls whether native host executables launch directly on Windows.

NativeWindowOcclusionEnabled.name: Enable Native Window Occlusion (deprecated)
NativeWindowOcclusionEnabled.summary: This policy is deprecated, use the '[WindowOcclusionEnabled](#windowocclusionenabled)' policy instead. It won't work in Microsoft Edge version 92.

NavigationDelayForInitialSiteListDownloa.name: Set a timeout for delay of tab navigation for the Enterprise Mode Site List
NavigationDelayForInitialSiteListDownloa.summary: Allows you to set a timeout, in seconds, for Microsoft Edge tabs waiting to navigate until the browser has downloaded the initial Enterprise Mode Site List.

NetworkPredictionOptions.name: Enable network prediction
NetworkPredictionOptions.summary: Enables network prediction and prevents users from changing this setting.

NetworkServiceSandboxEnabled.name: Enable the network service sandbox
NetworkServiceSandboxEnabled.summary: This policy controls whether or not the network service process runs sandboxed.

NewBaseUrlInheritanceBehaviorAllowed.name: Allows enabling the feature NewBaseUrlInheritanceBehavior (deprecated)
NewBaseUrlInheritanceBehaviorAllowed.summary: NewBaseUrlInheritanceBehavior is a Microsoft Edge feature that causes about:blank and about:srcdoc frames to consistently inherit their base url values via snapshots of their initiator's base url.

NewPDFReaderEnabled.name: Microsoft Edge built-in PDF reader powered by Adobe Acrobat enabled
NewPDFReaderEnabled.summary: The policy lets Microsoft Edge launch the new version of the built-in PDF reader that's powered by Adobe Acrobat's PDF rendering engine. The new PDF reader ensures that there's no loss of functionality and delivers an enhanced PDF experience. This experience includes richer rendering, improved performance, strong security for PDF handling, and greater accessibility.

NonRemovableProfileEnabled.name: Configure whether a user always has a default profile automatically signed in with their work or school account
NonRemovableProfileEnabled.summary: This policy determines if a user can remove the Microsoft Edge profile automatically signed in with a user's work or school account.

OrganizationLogoOverlayOnAppIconEnabled.name: Allow your organization's logo from Microsoft Entra to be overlaid on the Microsoft Edge app icon of a work profile
OrganizationLogoOverlayOnAppIconEnabled.summary: Allow your organization's logo from Entra, if any, to be overlaid on the Microsoft Edge app icon of a profile that's signed in with an Entra ID (formerly known as Azure Active Directory) account. This requires a browser restart to take effect.

OrganizationalBrandingOnWorkProfileUIEna.name: Allow the use of your organization's branding assets from Microsoft Entra on the profile-related UI of a work profile
OrganizationalBrandingOnWorkProfileUIEna.summary: Allow the use of your organization's branding assets from Entra, if any, on the profile-related UI of a profile that's signed in with an Entra ID (formerly known as Azure Active Directory) account. This requires a browser restart to take effect.

OriginAgentClusterDefaultEnabled.name: Origin-keyed agent clustering enabled by default
OriginAgentClusterDefaultEnabled.summary: The Origin-Agent-Cluster: HTTP header controls whether a document is isolated in an origin-keyed agent cluster or in a site-keyed agent cluster. This has security implications because an origin-keyed agent cluster allows isolating documents by origin. The consequence of this for developers is that the document.domain accessor can no longer be set when origin-keyed agent clustering is enabled.

OutlookHubMenuEnabled.name: Allow users to access the Outlook menu (obsolete)
OutlookHubMenuEnabled.summary: This policy doesn't work because the Outlook menu is now contained within the Edge Sidebar and can be managed using the [HubsSidebarEnabled](#hubssidebarenabled) policy.

OverrideSecurityRestrictionsOnInsecureOr.name: Control where security restrictions on insecure origins apply
OverrideSecurityRestrictionsOnInsecureOr.summary: Specifies a list of origins (URLs) or hostname patterns (like "*.contoso.com") for which security restrictions on insecure origins don't apply.

PDFSecureMode.name: Secure mode and Certificate-based Digital Signature validation in native PDF reader
PDFSecureMode.summary: The policy enables Digital Signature validation for PDF files in a secure environment, which shows the correct validation status of the signatures.

PDFXFAEnabled.name: XFA support in native PDF reader enabled
PDFXFAEnabled.summary: Lets the Microsoft Edge browser enable XFA (XML Forms Architecture) support in the native PDF reader and allows users to open XFA PDF files in the browser.

PaymentMethodQueryEnabled.name: Allow websites to query for available payment methods
PaymentMethodQueryEnabled.summary: Allows you to set whether websites can check if the user has payment methods saved.

PersonalizationReportingEnabled.name: Allow personalization of ads, Microsoft Edge, search, news and other Microsoft services by sending browsing history, favorites and collections, usage and other browsing data to Microsoft
PersonalizationReportingEnabled.summary: This policy prevents Microsoft from collecting a user's Microsoft Edge browsing history, favorites and collections, usage, and other browsing data to be used for personalizing advertising, search, news, Microsoft Edge and other Microsoft services.

PersonalizeTopSitesInCustomizeSidebarEna.name: Personalize my top sites in Customize Sidebar enabled by default
PersonalizeTopSitesInCustomizeSidebarEna.summary: This policy controls whether Microsoft Edge browser be allowed to use the browsing history to personalize the top sites in the customize sidebar page.

PictureInPictureOverlayEnabled.name: Enable Picture in Picture overlay feature on supported webpages in Microsoft Edge
PictureInPictureOverlayEnabled.summary: This policy lets you configure the Picture in Picture floating overlay button in Microsoft Edge.

PinningWizardAllowed.name: Allow Pin to taskbar wizard
PinningWizardAllowed.summary: Microsoft Edge uses the Pin to taskbar wizard to help users pin suggested sites to the taskbar. The Pin to taskbar wizard feature is enabled by default and accessible to the user through the Settings and more menu.

PostQuantumKeyAgreementEnabled.name: Enable post-quantum key agreement for TLS
PostQuantumKeyAgreementEnabled.summary: This policy configures whether Microsoft Edge will offer a post-quantum key agreement algorithm in TLS. This lets supporting servers protect user traffic from being decrypted by quantum computers.

ProactiveAuthEnabled.name: Enable Proactive Authentication (obsolete)
ProactiveAuthEnabled.summary: This policy is obsolete because it does not work independently of browser sign in. It does not work in Microsoft Edge after version 90. If you want to configure browser sign in, use the [BrowserSignin](#browsersignin) policy.

PromotionalTabsEnabled.name: Enable full-tab promotional content (deprecated)
PromotionalTabsEnabled.summary: Control the presentation of full-tab promotional or educational content. This setting controls the presentation of welcome pages that help users sign into Microsoft Edge, choose their default browser, or learn about product features.

PromptForDownloadLocation.name: Ask where to save downloaded files
PromptForDownloadLocation.summary: Set whether to ask where to save a file before downloading it.

PromptOnMultipleMatchingCertificates.name: Prompt the user to select a certificate when multiple certificates match
PromptOnMultipleMatchingCertificates.summary: This policy controls whether the user is prompted to select a client certificate when more than one certificate matches [AutoSelectCertificateForUrls](#autoselectcertificateforurls).

QRCodeGeneratorEnabled.name: Enable QR Code Generator
QRCodeGeneratorEnabled.summary: This policy enables the QR Code generator feature in Microsoft Edge.

QuicAllowed.name: Allow QUIC protocol
QuicAllowed.summary: Allows use of the QUIC protocol in Microsoft Edge.

QuickSearchShowMiniMenu.name: Enables Microsoft Edge mini menu
QuickSearchShowMiniMenu.summary: Enables Microsoft Edge mini menu on websites and PDFs. The mini menu is triggered on text selection and has basic actions like copy and smart actions like definitions.

QuickViewOfficeFilesEnabled.name: Manage QuickView Office files capability in Microsoft Edge
QuickViewOfficeFilesEnabled.summary: Allows you to set whether users can view publicly accessible Office files on the web that aren't on OneDrive or SharePoint. (For example: Word documents, PowerPoint presentations, and Excel spreadsheets)

RSAKeyUsageForLocalAnchorsEnabled.name: Check RSA key usage for server certificates issued by local trust anchors (deprecated)
RSAKeyUsageForLocalAnchorsEnabled.summary: This policy is deprecated because RSAKeyUsageForLocalAnchorsEnabled feature has been removed.

ReadAloudEnabled.name: Enable Read Aloud feature in Microsoft Edge
ReadAloudEnabled.summary: Enables the Read Aloud feature within Microsoft Edge.

RedirectSitesFromInternetExplorerPrevent.name: Prevent install of the BHO to redirect incompatible sites from Internet Explorer to Microsoft Edge
RedirectSitesFromInternetExplorerPrevent.summary: This setting lets you specify whether to block the install of the Browser Helper Object (BHO) that enables redirecting incompatible sites from Internet Explorer to Microsoft Edge for sites that require a modern browser.

RedirectSitesFromInternetExplorerRedirec.name: Redirect incompatible sites from Internet Explorer to Microsoft Edge
RedirectSitesFromInternetExplorerRedirec.summary: This setting lets you specify whether Internet Explorer will redirect navigations to sites that require a modern browser to Microsoft Edge.

RelatedMatchesCloudServiceEnabled.name: Configure Related Matches in Find on Page
RelatedMatchesCloudServiceEnabled.summary: Specifies how the user receives related matches in Find on Page, which provides spellcheck, synonyms, and Q&A results in Microsoft Edge.

RelaunchNotification.name: Notify a user that a browser restart is recommended or required for pending updates
RelaunchNotification.summary: Notify users that they need to restart Microsoft Edge to apply a pending update.

RelaunchNotificationPeriod.name: Set the time period for update notifications
RelaunchNotificationPeriod.summary: Allows you to set the time period, in milliseconds, over which users are notified that Microsoft Edge must be relaunched to apply a pending update.

RelaunchWindow.name: Set the time interval for relaunch
RelaunchWindow.summary: Specifies a target time window for the end of the relaunch notification period.

RemoteDebuggingAllowed.name: Allow remote debugging
RemoteDebuggingAllowed.summary: Controls whether users may use remote debugging.

RendererAppContainerEnabled.name: Enable renderer in app container
RendererAppContainerEnabled.summary: Launches Renderer processes into an App Container for

RendererCodeIntegrityEnabled.name: Enable renderer code integrity (deprecated)
RendererCodeIntegrityEnabled.summary: Setting the policy to Enabled or leaving it unset turns Renderer Code Integrity on.

RequireOnlineRevocationChecksForLocalAnc.name: Specify if online OCSP/CRL checks are required for local trust anchors
RequireOnlineRevocationChecksForLocalAnc.summary: Control whether online revocation checks (OCSP/CRL checks) are required. If Microsoft Edge can't get revocation status information, these certificates are treated as revoked ("hard-fail").

ResolveNavigationErrorsUseWebService.name: Enable resolution of navigation errors using a web service
ResolveNavigationErrorsUseWebService.summary: Allow Microsoft Edge to issue a dataless connection to a web service to probe networks for connectivity in cases like hotel and airport Wi-Fi.

RestorePdfView.name: Restore PDF view
RestorePdfView.summary: Enables PDF View Recovery in Microsoft Edge.

RestrictSigninToPattern.name: Restrict which accounts can be used to sign in to Microsoft Edge
RestrictSigninToPattern.summary: Determines which accounts can be used to sign in to the Microsoft Edge account that's chosen during the Sync opt-in flow.

RoamingProfileLocation.name: Set the roaming profile directory
RoamingProfileLocation.summary: Configures the directory to use to store the roaming copy of profiles.

RoamingProfileSupportEnabled.name: Enable using roaming copies for Microsoft Edge profile data
RoamingProfileSupportEnabled.summary: Enable this policy to use roaming profiles on Windows. The settings stored in Microsoft Edge profiles (favorites and preferences) are also saved to a file stored in the Roaming user profile folder (or the location specified by the administrator through the [RoamingProfileLocation](#roamingprofilelocation) policy).

RunAllFlashInAllowMode.name: Extend Adobe Flash content setting to all content (obsolete)
RunAllFlashInAllowMode.summary: This policy doesn't work because Flash is no longer supported by Microsoft Edge.

SSLErrorOverrideAllowed.name: Allow users to proceed from the HTTPS warning page
SSLErrorOverrideAllowed.summary: Microsoft Edge shows a warning page when users visit sites that have SSL errors.

SSLErrorOverrideAllowedForOrigins.name: Allow users to proceed from the HTTPS warning page for specific origins
SSLErrorOverrideAllowedForOrigins.summary: Microsoft Edge shows a warning page when users visit sites that have SSL errors.

SSLVersionMin.name: Minimum TLS version enabled (obsolete)
SSLVersionMin.summary: This policy was removed in Microsoft Edge 98 and is ignored if configured.

SandboxExternalProtocolBlocked.name: Allow Microsoft Edge to block navigations to external protocols in a sandboxed iframe
SandboxExternalProtocolBlocked.summary: Microsoft Edge will block navigations to external protocols inside a

SaveCookiesOnExit.name: Save cookies when Microsoft Edge closes
SaveCookiesOnExit.summary: When this policy is enabled, the specified set of cookies is exempt from deletion when the browser closes. This policy is only effective when:

SavingBrowserHistoryDisabled.name: Disable saving browser history
SavingBrowserHistoryDisabled.summary: Disables saving browser history and prevents users from changing this setting.

ScreenCaptureAllowed.name: Allow or deny screen capture
ScreenCaptureAllowed.summary: If you enable this policy, or don't configure this policy, a web page can use screen-share APIs (for example, getDisplayMedia() or the Desktop Capture extension API) for a screen capture.

ScreenCaptureWithoutGestureAllowedForOri.name: Allow screen capture without prior user gesture

ScrollToTextFragmentEnabled.name: Enable scrolling to text specified in URL fragments
ScrollToTextFragmentEnabled.summary: This feature lets hyperlink and address bar URL navigations target specific text on a web page, which will be scrolled to after the web page finishes loading.

SearchFiltersEnabled.name: Search Filters Enabled
SearchFiltersEnabled.summary: Lets you filter your autosuggestions by selecting a filter from the search filters ribbon. For example, if you select the "Favorites" filter, only favorites suggestions will be shown.

SearchForImageEnabled.name: Search for image enabled
SearchForImageEnabled.summary: This policy lets you configure the Image Search feature in the right-click context menu.

SearchInSidebarEnabled.name: Search in Sidebar enabled
SearchInSidebarEnabled.summary: Search in Sidebar allows users to open search result in sidebar (including sidebar search for Progressive Web Apps).

SearchSuggestEnabled.name: Enable search suggestions
SearchSuggestEnabled.summary: Enables web search suggestions in Microsoft Edge's Address Bar and Auto-Suggest List and prevents users from changing this policy.

SearchbarAllowed.name: Enable the Search bar
SearchbarAllowed.summary: Enables the search bar. When enabled, users can use the search bar to search the web from their desktop or from an application. The search bar provides a search box, powered by Edge default search engine, that shows web suggestions and opens all web searches in Microsoft Edge. The search bar can be launched from the "More tools" menu or jump list in Microsoft Edge.

SearchbarIsEnabledOnStartup.name: Allow the Search bar at Windows startup
SearchbarIsEnabledOnStartup.summary: Allows the Search bar to start running at Windows startup.

SecurityKeyPermitAttestation.name: Websites or domains that don't need permission to use direct Security Key attestation
SecurityKeyPermitAttestation.summary: Specifies the WebAuthn RP IDs that don't need explicit user permission when attestation certificates from security keys are requested. Additionally, a signal is sent to the security key indicating that it can use enterprise attestation. Without this policy, users are prompted each time a site requests attestation of security keys.

SelectParserRelaxationEnabled.name: Controls whether the new HTML parser behavior for the \<select> element is enabled
SelectParserRelaxationEnabled.summary: The HTML parser is being changed to allow additional HTML tags inside the \<select> element. This policy supports the old HTML parser behavior until M136.

SendIntranetToInternetExplorer.name: Send all intranet sites to Internet Explorer
SendIntranetToInternetExplorer.summary: For guidance about configuring the optimal experience for Internet Explorer mode see [https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2094210](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2094210)

SendMouseEventsDisabledFormControlsEnabl.name: Control the new behavior for event dispatching on disabled form controls (obsolete)
SendMouseEventsDisabledFormControlsEnabl.summary: Event dispatching on disabled form controls is being changed in Edge to improve compatibility with other browsers and to improve the developer experience.

SendSiteInfoToImproveServices.name: Send site information to improve Microsoft services (obsolete)
SendSiteInfoToImproveServices.summary: This policy is no longer supported. It is replaced by [DiagnosticData](#diagnosticdata) (for Windows 7, Windows 8, and macOS) and Allow Telemetry on Win 10 ([https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2099569](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2099569)).

SensorsAllowedForUrls.name: Allow access to sensors on specific sites
SensorsAllowedForUrls.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that can access and use sensors such as motion and light sensors.

SensorsBlockedForUrls.name: Block access to sensors on specific sites
SensorsBlockedForUrls.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that can't access sensors such as motion and light sensors.

SerialAskForUrls.name: Allow the Serial API on specific sites
SerialAskForUrls.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that can ask the user for access to a serial port.

SerialBlockedForUrls.name: Block the Serial API on specific sites
SerialBlockedForUrls.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that can't ask the user to grant them access to a serial port.

SetTimeoutWithout1MsClampEnabled.name: Control Javascript setTimeout() function minimum timeout (obsolete)
SetTimeoutWithout1MsClampEnabled.summary: This policy is obsolete and doesn't work in Microsoft Edge after version 109.

ShadowStackCrashRollbackBehavior.name: Configure ShadowStack crash rollback behavior (obsolete)
ShadowStackCrashRollbackBehavior.summary: This policy is deprecated because it's intended to serve only as a short-term mechanism to give enterprises more time to update their environments and report issues if they are found to be incompatible with Hardware-enforced Stack Protection. It won't work in Microsoft Edge as soon as version 109.

SharedArrayBufferUnrestrictedAccessAllow.name: Specifies whether SharedArrayBuffers can be used in a non cross-origin-isolated context
SharedArrayBufferUnrestrictedAccessAllow.summary: Specifies whether SharedArrayBuffers can be used in a non cross-origin-isolated context.  A SharedArrayBuffer is a binary data buffer that can be used to create views on shared memory.  SharedArrayBuffers have a memory access vulnerability in several popular CPUs.

SharedLinksEnabled.name: Show links shared from Microsoft 365 apps in History
SharedLinksEnabled.summary: Allows Microsoft Edge to display links recently shared by or shared with the user from Microsoft 365 apps in History.

ShowAcrobatSubscriptionButton.name: Shows button on native PDF viewer in Microsoft Edge that allows users to sign up for Adobe Acrobat subscription
ShowAcrobatSubscriptionButton.summary: This policy lets the native PDF viewer in Microsoft Edge show a button that lets a user looking for advanced digital document features to discover and subscribe to premium offerings. This is done via the Acrobat extension.

ShowDownloadsToolbarButton.name: Show Downloads button on the toolbar
ShowDownloadsToolbarButton.summary: Set this policy to always show the Downloads button on the toolbar.

ShowHistoryThumbnails.name: Show thumbnail images for browsing history
ShowHistoryThumbnails.summary: This policy lets you configure whether the history thumbnail feature collects and saves images for the sites you visit.  When enabled, this feature makes it easier to identify sites when you hover over your history results.

ShowMicrosoftRewards.name: Show Microsoft Rewards experiences
ShowMicrosoftRewards.summary: Show Microsoft Rewards experience and notifications.

ShowOfficeShortcutInFavoritesBar.name: Show Microsoft Office shortcut in favorites bar (deprecated)
ShowOfficeShortcutInFavoritesBar.summary: This policy didn't work as expected due to changes in operational requirements. Therefore it's deprecated and should not be used.

ShowRecommendationsEnabled.name: Allow feature recommendations and browser assistance notifications from Microsoft Edge
ShowRecommendationsEnabled.summary: This setting controls the in-browser assistance notifications which are intended to help users get the most out of Microsoft Edge. This is done by recommending features and by helping them use  browser features. These notifications take the form of dialog boxes, flyouts, coach marks and banners in the browser.  An example of an  assistance notification would be when a user has many tabs opened in the browser.  In this instance Microsoft Edge may prompt the user to try out the vertical tabs feature which is designed to give better browser tab management.

SignedHTTPExchangeEnabled.name: Enable Signed HTTP Exchange (SXG) support
SignedHTTPExchangeEnabled.summary: Enable support for Signed HTTP Exchange (SXG).

SitePerProcess.name: Enable site isolation for every site
SitePerProcess.summary: The 'SitePerProcess' policy can be used to prevent users from opting out of the default behavior of isolating all sites. Note that you can also use the [IsolateOrigins](#isolateorigins) policy to isolate additional, finer-grained origins.

SiteSafetyServicesEnabled.name: Allow users to configure Site safety services (obsolete)
SiteSafetyServicesEnabled.summary: This policy is obselete as the feature is being removed after Microsoft Edge version 127.

SmartActionsBlockList.name: Block smart actions for a list of services
SmartActionsBlockList.summary: List specific services, such as PDFs, and websites that don't show smart actions. (Smart actions are actions like "define" which are available in full and mini context menus in Microsoft Edge.)

SpeechRecognitionEnabled.name: Configure Speech Recognition
SpeechRecognitionEnabled.summary: Set whether websites can use the W3C Web Speech API to recognize speech from the user. The Microsoft Edge implementation of the Web Speech API uses Azure Cognitive Services, so voice data will leave the machine.

SpellcheckEnabled.name: Enable spellcheck
SpellcheckEnabled.summary: If you enable or don't configure this policy, the user can use spellcheck.

SpellcheckLanguage.name: Enable specific spellcheck languages
SpellcheckLanguage.summary: Enables different languages for spellcheck. Any language that you specify that isn't recognized is ignored.

SpellcheckLanguageBlocklist.name: Force disable spellcheck languages
SpellcheckLanguageBlocklist.summary: Force-disables spellcheck languages. Unrecognized languages in that list will be ignored.

SplitScreenEnabled.name: Enable split screen feature in Microsoft Edge
SplitScreenEnabled.summary: This policy lets you configure the split screen feature in Microsoft Edge. This feature lets a user open two web pages in one tab.

StandaloneHubsSidebarEnabled.name: Standalone Sidebar Enabled
StandaloneHubsSidebarEnabled.summary: Standalone Sidebar is an optional mode for the Sidebar in Microsoft Edge. When this mode is activated by a user, the Sidebar appears in a fixed position on the Microsoft Windows desktop, and is hidden from the browser application frame.

StricterMixedContentTreatmentEnabled.name: Enable stricter treatment for mixed content (obsolete)
StricterMixedContentTreatmentEnabled.summary: This policy doesn't work because it was only intended to be a short-term mechanism to give enterprises more time to update their web content if it was found to be incompatible with stricter mixed content treatment.

SuperDragDropEnabled.name: Super Drag Drop Enabled
SuperDragDropEnabled.summary: This policy lets you configure the Super Drag Drop feature in Microsoft Edge.

SuppressUnsupportedOSWarning.name: Suppress the unsupported OS warning
SuppressUnsupportedOSWarning.summary: Suppresses the warning that appears when Microsoft Edge is running on a computer or operating system that is no longer supported.

SyncDisabled.name: Disable synchronization of data using Microsoft sync services
SyncDisabled.summary: Disables data synchronization in Microsoft Edge. This policy also prevents the sync consent prompt from appearing.

SyncTypesListDisabled.name: Configure the list of types that are excluded from synchronization
SyncTypesListDisabled.summary: If you enable this policy all the specified data types will be excluded from synchronization. This policy can be used to limit the type of data uploaded to the Microsoft Edge synchronization service.

TLS13HardeningForLocalAnchorsEnabled.name: Enable a TLS 1.3 security feature for local trust anchors (obsolete)
TLS13HardeningForLocalAnchorsEnabled.summary: This policy doesn't work because it was only intended to be a short-term mechanism to give enterprises more time to upgrade affected proxies.

TLSCipherSuiteDenyList.name: Specify the TLS cipher suites to disable
TLSCipherSuiteDenyList.summary: Configure the list of cipher suites that are disabled for TLS connections.

TabFreezingEnabled.name: Allow freezing of background tabs (obsolete)
TabFreezingEnabled.summary: This policy doesn't work, use [SleepingTabsEnabled](#sleepingtabsenabled) instead.

TabServicesEnabled.name: Enable tab organization suggestions
TabServicesEnabled.summary: This policy controls whether Microsoft Edge can use its tab organization service to help name or suggest tab groups to increase productivity.

TargetBlankImpliesNoOpener.name: Do not set window.opener for links targeting _blank (obsolete)
TargetBlankImpliesNoOpener.summary: If you enable this policy or leave it unset, the window.opener property is set to null unless the anchor specifies rel="opener".

TaskManagerEndProcessEnabled.name: Enable ending processes in the Browser task manager
TaskManagerEndProcessEnabled.summary: If you enable or don't configure this policy, users can end processes in the Browser task manager. If you disable it, users can't end processes, and the End process button is disabled in the Browser task manager.

TextPredictionEnabled.name: Text prediction enabled by default
TextPredictionEnabled.summary: The Microsoft Turing service uses natural language processing to generate predictions for long-form editable text fields on web pages.

ThrottleNonVisibleCrossOriginIframesAllo.name: Allows enabling throttling of non-visible, cross-origin iframes (obsolete)
ThrottleNonVisibleCrossOriginIframesAllo.summary: Throttling of cross-origin frames that are display:none and non-visible is a feature designed to make cross-process and same-process cross-origin iframes consistent in their rendering behavior. For more details on cross-process vs. same-process throttling, refer to [https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2239564](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2239564).

TotalMemoryLimitMb.name: Set limit on megabytes of memory a single Microsoft Edge instance can use
TotalMemoryLimitMb.summary: Configures the amount of memory that a single Microsoft Edge instance can use before tabs start getting discarded to save memory. The memory used by the tab will be freed and the tab will have to be reloaded when switched to.

TrackingPrevention.name: Block tracking of users' web-browsing activity
TrackingPrevention.summary: Lets you decide whether to block websites from tracking users' web-browsing activity.

TranslateEnabled.name: Enable Translate
TranslateEnabled.summary: Enables the integrated Microsoft translation service on Microsoft Edge.

TravelAssistanceEnabled.name: Enable travel assistance (obsolete)
TravelAssistanceEnabled.summary: This policy is obsolete as the feature is now contained within the Edge Sidebar and can be managed using the [HubsSidebarEnabled](#hubssidebarenabled) policy. It doesn't work in Microsoft Edge after version 105.

TripleDESEnabled.name: Enable 3DES cipher suites in TLS (obsolete)
TripleDESEnabled.summary: 'This policy was removed in version 97 after 3DES was removed from Microsoft Edge.

U2fSecurityKeyApiEnabled.name: Allow using the deprecated U2F Security Key API (obsolete)
U2fSecurityKeyApiEnabled.summary: This policy is obsolete because it was intended to be a short-term mechanism to give enterprises more time to update their web content when it's found to be incompatible with the change to remove the U2F Security Key API. It doesn't work in Microsoft Edge after version 103.

URLAllowlist.name: Define a list of allowed URLs
URLAllowlist.summary: Setting the policy provides access to the listed URLs, as exceptions to [URLBlocklist](#urlblocklist).

URLBlocklist.name: Block access to a list of URLs
URLBlocklist.summary: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that are blocked (your users can't load them).

UnthrottledNestedTimeoutEnabled.name: JavaScript setTimeout will not be clamped until a higher nesting threshold is set (deprecated)
UnthrottledNestedTimeoutEnabled.summary: This policy is deprecated because it is a temporary policy for web standards compliance. It won't work in Microsoft Edge as soon as version 107.

UpdatePolicyOverride.name: Specifies how Microsoft Edge Update handles available updates from Microsoft Edge
UpdatePolicyOverride.summary: If you enable this policy, Microsoft Edge Update handles Microsoft Edge updates according to how you configure the following options:

UploadFromPhoneEnabled.name: Enable upload files from mobile in Microsoft Edge desktop
UploadFromPhoneEnabled.summary: This policy lets you configure the "Upload from mobile" feature in Microsoft Edge.

UrlDiagnosticDataEnabled.name: URL reporting in Edge diagnostic data enabled
UrlDiagnosticDataEnabled.summary: Controls sending URLs of pages visited and per-page usage in the Microsoft Edge optional diagnostics data to Microsoft to help make browsing and search better. This also includes identifiers and usage diagnostics of other browser components that can modify or provide content, such as extensions.

UserAgentClientHintsEnabled.name: Enable the User-Agent Client Hints feature (obsolete)
UserAgentClientHintsEnabled.summary: This policy is obsolete because it was intended for short-term adaptation purposes only. It doesn't work in Microsoft Edge after version 93.

UserAgentClientHintsGREASEUpdateEnabled.name: Control the User-Agent Client Hints GREASE Update feature
UserAgentClientHintsGREASEUpdateEnabled.summary: The User-Agent GREASE specification recommends the inclusion of additional GREASE characters beyond the current semicolon and space, and recommends that the arbitrary version number be varied over time.

UserAgentReduction.name: Enable or disable the User-Agent Reduction
UserAgentReduction.summary: The User-Agent HTTP request header is scheduled to be reduced. To facilitate testing and compatibility, this policy can enable the reduction feature for all websites, or disable the ability for origin trials, or field trials to enable the feature.

UserDataDir.name: Set the user data directory
UserDataDir.summary: Set the directory to use for storing user data.

UserDataSnapshotRetentionLimit.name: Limits the number of user data snapshots retained for use in case of emergency rollback
UserDataSnapshotRetentionLimit.summary: Following each major version update, Microsoft Edge will create a snapshot of parts of the user's browsing data to use in case of a later emergency that requires a temporary version rollback. If a temporary rollback is performed to a version for which a user has a corresponding snapshot, the data in the snapshot is restored. This lets users keep settings such as bookmarks and autofill data.

UserFeedbackAllowed.name: Allow user feedback
UserFeedbackAllowed.summary: Microsoft Edge uses the Edge Feedback feature (enabled by default) to allow users to send feedback, suggestions or customer surveys and to report any issues with the browser. Also, by default, users can't disable (turn off) the Edge Feedback feature.

VerticalTabsAllowed.name: Configures availability of a vertical layout for tabs on the side of the browser
VerticalTabsAllowed.summary: Configures whether a user can access an alternative layout where tabs are vertically aligned on the side of the browser instead of at the top.

VideoCaptureAllowed.name: Allow or block video capture
VideoCaptureAllowed.summary: Control whether sites can capture video.

VideoCaptureAllowedUrls.name: Sites that can access video capture devices without requesting permission
VideoCaptureAllowedUrls.summary: Specify websites, based on URL patterns, that can use video capture devices without asking the user for permission. Patterns in this list are matched against the security origin of the requesting URL. If they match, the site is automatically granted access to video capture devices. Note, however, that the pattern "*", which matches any URL, is not supported by this policy.

VisualSearchEnabled.name: Visual search enabled
VisualSearchEnabled.summary: Visual search lets you quickly explore more related content about entities in an image.

WPADQuickCheckEnabled.name: Set WPAD optimization
WPADQuickCheckEnabled.summary: Allows you to turn off WPAD (Web Proxy Auto-Discovery) optimization in Microsoft Edge.

WalletDonationEnabled.name: Wallet Donation Enabled
WalletDonationEnabled.summary: The Wallet Donation feature in Microsoft Edge allows users to view their donation summary, explore Nonprofit organizations (NPOs), donate to an NPO, manage their monthly donations, and view their donation history.

WebAppInstallForceList.name: Configure list of force-installed Web Apps
WebAppInstallForceList.summary: Setting the policy specifies a list of web apps that install silently, without user interaction.  Users can't turn off the policy or uninstall these web apps.

WebAppSettings.name: Web App management settings
WebAppSettings.summary: This policy allows an admin to specify settings for installed web apps. This policy maps a Web App ID to its specific setting. A default configuration can be set using the special ID *, which applies to all web apps without a custom configuration in this policy.

WebCaptureEnabled.name: Enable the Screenshot (previously named Web Capture) feature in Microsoft Edge
WebCaptureEnabled.summary: Note: The web capture feature is rebranded to "Screenshot".

WebComponentsV0Enabled.name: Re-enable Web Components v0 API until M84 (obsolete)
WebComponentsV0Enabled.summary: This policy doesn't work because this policy allowed these features to be selectively re-enabled until Microsoft Edge version 85. The Web Components v0 APIs (Shadow DOM v0, Custom Elements v0, and HTML Imports) were deprecated in 2018, and have been disabled by default starting in Microsoft Edge version 80.

WebDriverOverridesIncompatiblePolicies.name: Allow WebDriver to Override Incompatible Policies (obsolete)
WebDriverOverridesIncompatiblePolicies.summary: This policy doesn't work because WebDriver is now compatible with all existing policies.

WebRtcAllowLegacyTLSProtocols.name: Allow legacy TLS/DTLS downgrade in WebRTC (obsolete)
WebRtcAllowLegacyTLSProtocols.summary: If you enable this policy, WebRTC peer connections can downgrade to obsolete

WebRtcLocalIpsAllowedUrls.name: Manage exposure of local IP addressess by WebRTC
WebRtcLocalIpsAllowedUrls.summary: Specifies a list of origins (URLs) or hostname patterns (like "*contoso.com*") for which local IP address should be exposed by WebRTC.

WebRtcLocalhostIpHandling.name: Restrict exposure of local IP address by WebRTC
WebRtcLocalhostIpHandling.summary: Allows you to set whether or not WebRTC exposes the user's local IP address.

WebRtcRespectOsRoutingTableEnabled.name: Enable support for Windows OS routing table rules when making peer to peer connections via WebRTC
WebRtcRespectOsRoutingTableEnabled.summary: Controls whether WebRTC will respect the Windows OS routing table rules when making peer to peer connections, thus enabling split tunnel VPNs.

WebRtcUdpPortRange.name: Restrict the range of local UDP ports used by WebRTC
WebRtcUdpPortRange.summary: Restricts the UDP port range used by WebRTC to a specified port interval (endpoints included).

WebSQLAccess.name: Force WebSQL to be enabled (obsolete)
WebSQLAccess.summary: This policy was removed in Microsoft Edge 124 and is ignored if set.

WebSQLInThirdPartyContextEnabled.name: Force WebSQL in third-party contexts to be re-enabled (obsolete)
WebSQLInThirdPartyContextEnabled.summary: This policy is obsolete because it was intended to be a short-term mechanism to give enterprises more time to update their web content when it's found to be incompatible with the change to disable WebSQL in third-party contexts. It doesn't work in Microsoft Edge after version 100.

WebSQLNonSecureContextEnabled.name: Force WebSQL in non-secure contexts to be enabled (obsolete)
WebSQLNonSecureContextEnabled.summary: This policy doesn't work because WebSQL in non-secure contexts is on by default as of Microsoft Edge 105.

WebSelectEnabled.name: Web Select Enabled (obsolete)
WebSelectEnabled.summary: This policy is obsoleted because Web Select is part of Web Capture and can be controlled by [WebCaptureEnabled](#webcaptureenabled). This policy won't work in Microsoft Edge version 117. If Web Capture is disabled by [WebCaptureEnabled](#webcaptureenabled), Web select will not be available in Web Capture.

WebWidgetAllowed.name: Enable the Search bar (deprecated)
WebWidgetAllowed.summary: Enables the search bar. When enabled, users can use the search bar to search the web from their desktop or from an application. The search bar provides a search box that shows web suggestions and opens all web searches in Microsoft Edge. The search box provides search (powered by Bing) and URL suggestions. The search bar can be launched  from the "More tools" menu or jump list in Microsoft Edge.

WebWidgetIsEnabledOnStartup.name: Allow the Search bar at Windows startup (obsolete)
WebWidgetIsEnabledOnStartup.summary: This policy is obsolete due to the deprecation of the Web widget, which is now known as Edge search bar. Admins should use SearchbarIsEnabledOnStartup for Edge search bar instead. Allows the Search bar to start running at Windows startup.

WinHttpProxyResolverEnabled.name: Use Windows proxy resolver
WinHttpProxyResolverEnabled.summary: This policy will be superseded by a similar feature in a future release. For more information, see https://crbug.com/1032820.

WindowOcclusionEnabled.name: Enable Window Occlusion
WindowOcclusionEnabled.summary: Enables window occlusion in Microsoft Edge.
